She is divorced and has six children. Her business is five years old. Her loan will be used to buy rice and beans to sell. She plans to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to buy rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cassava to produce her gari to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana fries doughnuts for sale at Ankwanda near Elmina. She lives together with her husband and three children. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their family. 

Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients that will enable her to fry doughnuts in larger quantity for sale. She hopes to build a snack bar with the new profits.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients that will enable her to fry doughnuts in larger quantity for sale.

loans.name: Al-Ahsan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ahsan. It consists of four ladies. All of them are friends and live in Taiz, Yemen. They have primarily worked different businesses for several years. The entire group took a loan of 200,000 YER. 

Asrar is a 28-year-old who lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is a hairdresser who works at home. She has developed a good reputation in her community for her customer dealings and good quality services. She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for many years. 

Asrar has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB for her business. With this loan, she will purchase cosmetics, which will allow her to fulfill her client orders on time and earn higher profits. She is confident of her business' success after investing the loan. She hopes to have a cosmetics shop in the future, in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them, for sale at Ankwanda, near Elmina. Ekua is married and has five children. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. A loan will help Ekua to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell. This will result in an increase in her income, so she will save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish, which she will smoke and sell.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 28-year-old man. He’s Lebanese, single, and is living with his parents and two working siblings. He is a great support to his father, their main income provider, especially after finding it hard to cover the usual family expenses on his own. 

Hussein has owned cattle since 2009, from which he obtained dairy products such as milk. He has been involved in this occupation since many years ago; he knows very well how to manage his work in a good way. He’s really good in his domain and looks forward to developing his business as much as he possibly can. 

For this reason, he wanted to take a youth loan form Kiva Partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase a milk machine. He will be utilizing this machine to facilitate the milk production process.  

In his opinion, this step will allow him to increase his productivity and therefore his earnings, and thus his whole way of living. This is how Hussein works every day to improve his way of living.

loans.use: to purchase a milk machine.

loans.name: Ekua (Agnes)

texts.en:
Ekua sells rice, sugar and gari (cassava flakes) in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. Ekua is single and has three children. 

She has been selling rice, sugar and gari for the past ten years. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees, as well as all other household expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice, sugar and gari for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar and gari for sale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 32 years old, married and has a 5-year-old child. She does farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years.  She mainly grows tomatoes, spinach and cabbages on her farm.  She has employed two people in her business.

Lucy also earns extra income from her rental houses.  Her desire is to practice large-scale farming in the future.  

She has requested 7,300 KES to buy a water tank for storage of water on her farm.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for storage of water on her farm.

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
Jawad is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has two children. His wife works and helps with the family income.

Jawad is a photographer and owns a studio. He specializes in producing video taped films. He established his business in 2008 and now he has an employee. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $2,400 to expand his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to expand his shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María de 47 años lleva una vida al lado de Manuel de 54 años, como único complemento de felicidad tiene a su pequeño Antony de 13 años, en su conjunto forman una familia en donde el amor y trabajo son sus motivos de ser.
Gracias a todos los años de esfuerzo y trabajo lograron culminar la construcción de una vivienda hecha a base de material noble.
Lleva desarrollando actividades agropecuarias en sus parcelas adquiridas conjuntamente con Manuel desde hace 20 años logrando establecer plantaciones de cacao que a la larga fueron obteniendo una calidad envidiable.
Durante todo este tiempo ha tenido diversas vivencias tanto buenas como malas pero siempre al lado de su pareja quien a su vez es su fiel compañero de trabajo sin obviar a los jornaleros que contrata para apoyar en actividades forzosas.
Al iniciarse la campaña del cacao correspondiente al año próximo realizó la remolición de una parte de sus parcelas para volverlas mas productivas y listas para realizar el sembrado de plantas de almácigo o cacao bebé , para el cual debe adquirir dichas plantas así como la compra de sacos de abono orgánico. Otro de los requerimientos necesarios para optimizar su producción es convocar a jornaleros para el sembrado de sombras temporales muy necesarias para que el sol no afecte directamente a las plantaciones jóvenes.
Es así como se desempeña con bastante motivación puesto que uno de sus objetivos a largo plazo es adquirir una vivienda en la capital de su región para así a futuro enviar a su hijo a desarrollar sus estudios superiores en una gran universidad. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, muy contenta se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Ve en sus compañeros de su banco comunal un buen equipo responsable y solidario lo cual hacen que se sienta muy confiada.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles otorgados realizará la compra de plantas de almácigo así como de sacos de abono orgánico, con el dinero restante complementará el pago a los jornaleros para el sembrado de árboles.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old and lives her life at the side of Manuel, who is 54. The one thing that completes her happiness is her little Antony, 13. Together they form a family where love and work are their reasons for being.

Thanks to all their years of work and effort they have managed to finish building a home made from good quality materials. She farms the parcels of land that she and Manuel have acquired. For 20 years they have been managing to establish cacao plantings, which over time have achieved an enviable quality.

During all this time she has had various life experiences, both good and bad, but always at the side of her partner. He in turn is her faithful work companion, not to forget the day laborers that she hires to help with the necessary work.

In beginning next year's cacao season, she has carried out the reconditioning of a part of her land to render it more productive, and ready for the planting of the seedlings or young cacao, for which she must acquire these plants and also buy sacks of organic fertilizer. 

Another of the her requirements for optimizing her output is to bring in day laborers for the planting of temporary shade trees which are very necessary so that the sun doesn't directly affect the plantings.

This is how she carries on with quite a bit of motivation, since one of her long-term objectives is to acquire a home in the region's capital. This is so that  in the future she can send her son to a fine university for his post-secondary studies 

This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy and promises to be punctual in making her installment payments. She sees her fellow communal bank members as a good team; responsible and supportive, and this makes her feel very confident.

With the 1000 nuevos soles she has been granted, she will buy cacao seedlings, as well as sacks of organic fertilizer. The remaining money will help pay for the day laborers for the tree-planting.

loans.use: To buy cacao seedlings, organic fertilizer, and hire day laborers.

loans.name: Omar Enrique

texts.es: Omar es casado tiene un hijo, el empezó a laborar a los 15 años pero en la actualidad no está trabajando ya que el desempleo va en aumento en nuestro país pero su mayor deseo es seguir adelante por lo que se está preparando estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en derecho con ayuda de su esposa quien le cubre los gastos universitarios, es por eso que Omar solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera para así poder obtener un buen trabajo, ayudar a su familia y poner en práctica sus conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en:
Omar is married and has one child. He started to work when he was 15 years old but he is not working right now due to the increase of unemployment in our country (Nicaragua). 
His biggest wish is to get ahead which is why he is studying for a law degree with the help of his wife, who pays for tuition fees. Omar is asking for a loan to pay the final fees to register his degree, so he can find a good job, help his family and make use of his knowledge.

loans.use: To pay for final fees to register his degree.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
With this loan of 50,000 KES, Mwanamisi will buy merchandise to restock her store where she sells fuel (diesel and petroleum) and charcoal. Her store is located at her home.

Mwanamisi is a married mother and has 8 children, three of whom are in school. Her hope is to see her business flourish and have a prosperous life in the future. 

Mwanamisi wants to have the ability to produce enough income to provide for her family. With this loan, she will buy more gallons of fuel and sacks of charcoal for sale. By doing this she is sure to have increased income.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of fuel and sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a 29-year-old married man. He has two children, ages one year and three years. He describes himself to be an honest and intelligent man. He operates a grocery stall where he sells vegetables and fruits such as cabbages, mangoes, onions, tomatoes etc. His business is located at a densely populated slum and his primary customers are residents from the slum. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds from improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell. His business goal is to be a wholesaler of vegetables and fruits within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have had expanded his business and improved the living standard of his family. This is  his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 50 kgs of chemical fertilizer and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: Madame Hawa est une femme veuve qui vit au Sénégal.  Elle vend des tissus est s’active dans le secteur depuis plus de 5 ans.  Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus a revendre.  Elle souhaite renforcer d’avantage son fond de roulement.  Les revenus que lui procure son activité  lui permet de supporter une partie des charges de  sa famille de 7 enfants.   Son objectif consiste à commencer l’exploitation de  sa propre boutique de vente de  vêtements pour  enfants. Aussi son intention dans le futur est d’acquérir un grand magasin de vente de tissus.
texts.en:
Hawa is a widowed woman who lives in Sénégal. She sells fabric and has been working in this field for more than 5 years. 

She is requesting a loan of 200,000 frs which will be used to buy fabric to resell. She wishes to strengthen her working capital even more. 

The income that her business generates for her allows her to support part of the responsibilities of her family of 7 children. Her goal consists in beginning to run her own boutique selling clothing for children. Her future intentions are also to acquire a large store to sell fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric to resell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 36 years old. He lives in Gori District with his wife and mother. George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the monthly pension of George’s mother. It makes a total of 150 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for a three-member family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

George requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of business start up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit George will rent space and start an auto repair business. George plans to purchase essential auto repair installations such as a tire changer and trim controller in order to respond rapidly to his clients' problems. He believes that acting properly is really essential to attracting more customers. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to rent a space and purchase auto repair installations

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is married and has seven children. She sells kenkey (fermented maize dough) in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, which she has done for the past eight years. Her husband is a farmer. Yaa uses her income to pay her children's school fees. Yaa will use the loan to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to continue to support her children.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, a single mother of three children, resides in one of the city's suburbs. She earns her income from small rooms that she lets out at affordable prices to low income earners. Florence educates her children and supports her needy relatives with the income from the rentals. She will use this loan to construct an underground water tank and also renovate the small rooms to make them more habitable for her tenants.

Florence is very shrewd and dreams of owning an estate of rental units. She says, "All things are possible as long as you believe," and is committed to pursuing her dreams until she gets a breakthrough. In the picture is Florence with the Ugafode credit officer in front of the house where she wants to put the tank.

loans.use: to buy materials for constructing a water tank.

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is 64 years old, married and has three children. To earn a living, he has been farming for two years, and his desire is to practice large-scale farming in the future.

Through Faulu Kenya, Zakaria has been able to purchase some farm inputs, and he is now requesting this loan for 53,156 KES to buy seeds and fertilizers. This will help him educate his children until university level.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es:
Rosmeri de 24 años tiene por pareja a Edwin de 32, ambos llevan una convivencia armónica que tiene como fruto de su amor al pequeño Edwin de 6 años. Dirige y labora conjuntamente con su pareja en el negocio de la carpintería desde hace 4 años. Se iniciaron debido a que como pareja joven buscaban un ingreso fijo para el sustento familiar, para entonces Edwin solo se desempañaba como ayudante en otros talleres, decidiéndose posteriormente  a independizarse gracias los préstamos de MFP y de sus ahorros de entonces.
Consideran una actividad de unión familiar pues ella apoya en actividades menores a su pareja mientras el se encarga de los trabajos principales y forzosos, han logrado así juntos consolidar su negocio convirtiéndolo en el principal sustento familiar, no obstante el retraso en la recepción de bloques de madera es el principal en ocasiones, pues deben cancelar algunos pedidos a causo de ello.
Para cumplir con los pedidos en adelante desean seguir invirtiendo en la compra de bloques de madera  para la fabricación de mesas, sillas, camas y otros.
Tiene el deseo de a futuro paralelo al negocio familiar expandirse con una tienda de abarrotes para así crecer económicamente, todo ello pensando en el futuro de su pequeño. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, considera que los créditos otorgados son para ella una gran herramienta de trabajo que se debe tratar con bastante responsabilidad. Con los 500 nuevos soles complementará su capital para la compra de bloques de madera, materia prima necesaria para cumplir con los pedidos que sus clientes solicitan.
texts.en:
Rosmeri is 24 years old and has a partner, Edwin, who is 32 years old. Both lead a harmonious coexistence and have, as the fruit of their love, their son Edwin, who is 6 years old. She has managed and worked together with her partner in their carpentry business for the last four years. The business started because the young couple was looking for a fixed income to support the family, because then Edwin was only working as a helper in other workshops. They decided later to become independent thanks to loans from MFP and their savings thereafter. 

They consider their work an activity of family union. Rosmeri helps with the minor activities in the pair while Edwin is in charge of the main, required work. Working together in this way they have succeeded in converting their business in to their primary family income. However, sometimes delays in the arrival of their wooden blocks causes them to have to cancel certain orders. 

In order to continue completing orders, they wish to continue investing in the purchase of blocks of wood for the fabrication of tables, chairs, beds, and more. In the future, Rosemeri wants to expand and open a grocery store parallel to the family business in order to grow economically; all of this is in thinking ahead for her son's future. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She considers the loans she receives to be an important work tool that must be treated with great responsibility. These 500 soles will complement her capital to buy blocks of wood and primary materials necessary to complete orders from her clients.

loans.use: to buy wood blocks and primary materials necessary to complete her customers' orders

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 58-year-old, widowed man from Lebanon, who lives with his nephews. Twenty years ago, he started to work in a lingerie shop, and after gaining the needed experience, he was able to open his own shop in 2009. His store is located in a strategic point; he has a fair number of loyal customers to whom he offers a wide variety of lingerie. 

Ali and his nephews are cooperating together for a better standard of living. And today, he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, to expand his store’s inventory of new lingerie collections. He’s sure and certain that the loan will help him diversify his merchandise selection. In the future, he is hoping to sell women's clothes, in addition to lingerie.

loans.use: to diversify his store’s inventory of new lingerie collections

loans.name: Majdoline

texts.en:
Majdoline is a 38-year-old woman. She lives with her husband, Samir, and their three children at their house, which is located in one of the beautiful Lebanese villages. Despite everything, Majdoline is obliged to work continually as she is responsible for supporting her husband with their family expenses. Her husband works in floor covering and has more than fifteen years of experience. 

Majdoline started to sell clothes from her home to avoid rent expenses. She provides her customers with good quality products at fair prices. She is satisfied with what she has attained so far, even though she wishes to enhance her family’s way of living the most. 

That’s the reason why she is asking today for a loan from Kiva Partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase a new winter collection. She notes that her sales will increase after these purchases, especially because of the holidays. 

In the near future, she wishes to open her own clothing shop and maybe hire new employees to help her achieve the work tasks and therefore earn a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase a new winter collection.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is single and has two children. She sells kenkey (fermented maize dough) in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. She has done this for the past seven years. 

Esi uses her income to take care of herself, paying all household and other expenses. She is 70 years old. 

Esi will use the loan to purchase maize for the production of kenkey. With the new profits, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize for the production of kenkey.

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en: Jaafar is a 31-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. He is from Lebanon. Since his marriage, Jaafar became the one responsible for his family and he had to work non-stop to support them properly financially. In 2008, he opened his own shop where he sells car accessories. His supplies are used in different types of cars. Today, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional car accessories in order to satisfy his customers' demands and provide them with top-quality services. Jaafar is very optimistic, ambitious, and always seeks the best; and this is the reason why he is doing a great effort in his professional career to progress and improve his finances.

loans.use: to purchase additional car accessories

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson, a 30-year-old married father of a three-year-old, has been operating a retail shop for a period of two years, earning an income of KES.10,000.  He is requesting his first loan of KES.10,000 from KADET LTD to purchase sugar, cooking fat, washing bar soaps, and powder. Wilson will reinvest the profits into his business, and hopes to own an expanded hardware shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking fat, washing bar soaps, and powder.

loans.name: Mayyada

texts.en: Mayyada is a 38-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and three siblings. All members of the family cooperate to maintain their respectable standard of living. Mayyada has owned a beauty salon since 2004, where she provides customers with beauty services such as hairdressing, make up, etc. Mayyada also has another job in order to supplement her income. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more beauty products and supplies. She intends to enhance her work operations by offering her clients high-quality services in order to satisfy their demands and keep them loyal to her shop. In the future, she plans to expand her business into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and supplies

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Married with no children, Ekua, who was educated through junior high, has been selling kenkey (fermented maize dough) in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, for the past three years. Ekua is responsible for helping her husband, a farmer, in paying for household expenses. Whatever she has left, she saves for the future and reinvests in the business.

Her loan will be used to buy more maize for the production of kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize for the production of kenkey.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Single with one grown child, Ama has been a fish monger for three years now. She buys fresh fish from the market and fries it for sale in Esissamkrom, near Cape Coast. Ama is responsible for paying household/living expenses and helping pay her grandchildren's school fees.

With this loan she will buy fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to use the resulting new profits to continue to support herself.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama  sells  footwear, sanitary towels, sauce pans and other cooking utensils in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. Ama has gone to school through junior high school.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. Ama has been in this business for 4 years. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy footwear, diapers, pots, pans, and cooking utensils to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy diapers,  pots, pans, and cooking utensils to sell

loans.name: Leon

texts.en: Leon is a 28-year-old man from Lebanon. He’s single and lives with his parents and one working sibling. His father is the one responsible for their needs and covering the house expenditures. One of Leon’s greatest dreams is to be able to take some responsibilities off of his father by earning a good income. He has been working independently. He sells electrical generators upon clients’ requests. Through his job, he will be able to enhance his family’s life and get married as he has always dreamed of. To help him achieve his goals, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed spare parts for the generators he owns. With this opportunity, he will improve his business and therefore boost his revenues.

loans.use: to purchase the needed spare parts for the generators he owns

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 37 years old and married with four children aged between 1 and 10 years old. He is a small-scale farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for ten years now, producing maize, tomatoes, beans and milk, which are all sold locally. He also operates a phone and battery charging business in the same town.

Fredrick has made a loan request of 62,400 KES (Kenyan shillings) through Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from the sale of milk will help him improve the livelihood of his family. He faces the challenges of diseases and lack of enough animal feed. 

He hopes to expand his dairy farming by acquiring additional dairy cows in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married and has six children. She sells banku and accra kenkey, food staples eaten with many dishes in Ghana, in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. She has been doing this for the past five years. Her husband is a farmer. Efua uses her income to pay for her children's school fees. Efua will use the loan to purchase maize and cassava, which is what kenkey and banku are made from. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy maize and cassava, which is what kenkey and banku are made from.

loans.name: Farak

texts.en:
Farak is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are employed. 

Farak is a farmer and owns a farm. He established his business in 1995 and now he has 3 employees. He built a good experience in this field and he is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Farak is requesting a sum of $2,400 loan to install a fence around his farm and to buy fodder for his cattle. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: install a fence around his farm and buy fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married and has three children. She operates a provisions store in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, which she has done for six years. Her husband is a farmer.  Efua uses her income to pay her children’s school fees.  Efua will use the loan to purchase canned fish, canned tomatoes, cooking oil, and other items for her provisions store. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua  plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: buy grocery items to resell

loans.name: Mirva

texts.en: Mirva is a 33-year-old married woman from Lebanon, a place known for its friendly and welcoming people. She’s living with her husband and two children. Mirva and her husband cooperate together to bring added income and enhance their way of living. Her husband is serving in the Lebanese army. As for Mirva, this ambitious young woman started her own home business in 2009. Her job consists of restoring computers and installing software as well. She works with high professionalism and always seeks to better improve her knowledge. This is why she looks today to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a laptop for her business. Definitely, this will boost her work and facilitate her business operations. Her future dreams are to be able to take bigger projects, and grow little by little.

loans.use: purchase a laptop

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a widow and has eight children. She sells limes and yams in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, which she has done for twenty-two years. 

Abena uses her income to pay for all household expenses and pay for her children's school fees.  She will use this loan to purchase yams and limes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to help her children succeed in life.

loans.use: purchase yams and limes to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi operates a provisions store in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. Esi has received an Education Completed status.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a sprayer for a local farm. 

Esi has owned her provisions store for four years now. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy foodstuff in bulk for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy foodstuff in bulk to sell

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is asking for a new loan to buy additional merchandise to sell such as bread, biscuits, soap, shampoo, and flour.  Thanks to his efforts where  he has successfully operated a motorcycle service, this has allowed him to have enough saving to open a retail shop. He says that he is still in his motorcycle business.

Kennedy is optimistic that if the loan is granted, he will be able to improve his store and attract more customers and buyers, which will improve his sales and profit. Since the previous loan, his living standards have greatly improved.

loans.use: buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is single and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Aba sells sugar cane in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, which she has done for two years. Aba uses her income for paying her children's school fees and other household/living expenses. Aba will use this loan to purchase more sugarcane to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to support herself and her family.

loans.use: buy sugarcane to resell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah  is married and has six children. She sells cosmetics, footwear, and sanitary towels in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, which she has done for the past eight years. Her husband is a farmer. Sarah uses her income to pay for her children's school fees. Sarah will use the loan to purchase cosmetics, sanitary towels and footwear to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics, sanitary towels and footwear to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi sells kenkey (fermented maize dough) in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. Esi has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Esi has been selling kenkey for the past three years. She is responsible for helping her husband pay for household expenses. Whatever she has left, she saves for the future and reinvests in the business. Her loan will be used to buy maize for the production of kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy maize to make kenkey for sale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi produces kenkey (fermented maize dough) for sale in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. Esi has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has 7 children.  Her husband is a farmer. 

Esi has been selling kenkey for the past three years. She is responsible for helping her husband pay for household expenses. Whatever she has left, she saves for the future and reinvests in the business. Her loan will be used to buy maize for the production of kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy maize to make kenkey for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 85 kg of chemical fertilizers and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Martine est une femme qui vit dans un quartier de la capitale. Mère de famille, elle gère un call-box dans un coin de la place depuis 02ans. Grâce à son dynamisme et sa témérité, elle s'est faite une grande dont elle aimerait continuer d'assurer la satisfaction. Pour cela elle sollicite un prêt pour acquérir une plus grande quantité de crédit de communication et des lignes supplémentaires( SE, camtel, etc..) . Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront d'augmenter son capital et d'améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en: Martine is a woman who lives in a neighborhood of the capital. A mother, she has been managing a call-box in a corner of the square for 2 years. Thanks to her dynamism and her audacity, she has acquired a large clientèle whose satisfaction she would like to continue to ensure. For this she is requesting a loan to acquire a larger quantity of communication credits and additional lines (SE, Camtel, etc.). The profits generated from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to acquire a larger quantity of communication credits and additional lines (SE, Camtel, etc.).

loans.name: Parfait Yves

texts.fr:
Parfait Yves est un jeune Camerounais âgé de 27 ans qui mène comme activité la vente des produits alimentaires sur comptoir dans un marché de la ville depuis 02 ans déjà. malgré sa jeune expérience, il bénéficie d'une clientèle considérable. il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter du riz, des cartons de tomates, savons, spaghettis pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et pourvoir mieux répondre à la demande.
il a pour ambition d'ouvrir une grande boutique et les revenus lui permettrons de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Parfait Yves is a young Cameroonian of 27 years old. He has been running his business selling food from stall in his town's market for the past two years. Despite not having much experience, he has an extensive customer base.

Parfait Yves wants to use this loan to buy rice, cartons of tomatoes, soap, and spaghetti to increase his stock of merchandise. This will allow him to be better able to meet his customers' demand. His ambition is to open a large shop so that he can earn more income and better provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase food to sell at his stall in the market.

loans.name: Maria Gladys

texts.es: María  Gladys de 53 anos de edad, casada con tres hijos mayores de edad, de la localidad del León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. María Gladys tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, negocio que consiste en la compra de ropa como: pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa interior, ropa de cama, zapatos. María Gladys tiene 17 anos de tener el negocio, el cual lo tiene ubicado en un lugar específico de la localidad. La Sra. en los créditos anteriores ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con prendas de vestir variada. María Gladys agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María Gladys is 53 years old, married and has three adult children. She is from the city of León, a place located in the western area of the country. María Gladys' work is the sale of general merchandise, a business which consists of the purchase and sale of clothing such as pants, shirts, skirts, underwear, sleepwear and shoes. María Gladys has had this business for 17 years, and it is located in a permanent location in the city.

In her previous loans, she showed herself to be responsible by paying in a timely way. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her store with a variety of clothing articles. 

She is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors provide to low-income people, and to poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that people can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: To have working capital and to restock her merchandise with varied clothing such as pants, shirts, skirts, underwear, sleepwear, and shoes.

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito is a 38-year-old married man and a father three children from Talibon, Bohol. He has been engaged in the fishing business for more than five years now. Julito also runs a sari-sari or variety store business.

Julito is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and additional merchandise to sell in his store such as canned goods, snack foods, chips, soaps and toiletries. With this, he will be able to improve his daily earnings.  Julito hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and additional merchandise to sell in his store such as canned goods, snack foods, chips, soaps and toiletries

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 20, single, and a mother of  a son who is 1 year of  age.  She stopped her education in the 10th grade. Janet lives in Jacob Town in a community called Amagashic.  Janet has a table at the community market where she sells flour, sugar, sardines, butter, eggs, and milk for the past seven years.  She is very proud of her business because with the profits she buys more goods and attends to her son needs. She received help from her father to start in this business, and learned to sell from her friend. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, eggs, sugar, sardines, and milk to increase her  sales, since she is the only source of income for her child. Her plan for the future is to further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, eggs, sugar, sardines, and milk to increase her  sales

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has seven children.  She sells limes, salted fish, and cooking ingredients in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, which she has been doing for three years. Her husband is a mason.  Ekua is responsible for paying school fees. 

Ekua is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy bags of limes, fresh fish, and cooking ingredients in bulk. She hopes to use the profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of limes, fresh fish, and cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua owns a chop bar (a small restaurant on the side of the road) in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. Ekua has received no formal education. She is divorced and has four children. Ekua has owned her chop bar for quite a few years now. She is responsible for taking care of her children (feeding, clothing, paying their school fees, etc.) as well as taking care of herself. She also pays for other household expenses such as utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients in bulk for the dishes she makes at her chop bar. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to care for herself and her children.

loans.use: buy ingredients for the dishes she makes at her chop bar

loans.name: Adwowa Suzzy

texts.en:
Adwowa Suzzy is married and has three children. She has received no formal education. She sells second-hand clothing, kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough that is wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and fish in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, which she has been doing for two years. Her husband is a farmer. Adwowa Suzzy uses her income to pay her children's school fees. 

Adwowa Suzzy is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase bags of maize to produce kenkey and second-hand clothing to sell. With the  profits, Adwowa Suzzy  plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to produce kenkey.

loans.name: Ma. Lifamy

texts.en:
Ma. Lifamy is a 27-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, and a mother of a five year old daughter.  She and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for almost three years now. This has been the source of their daily income.

Ma. Lifamy is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to catch more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Ma. Lifamy hopes of expanding their business and save money for reinvestment in their business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr: Daouda est un homme marié.Il tient un magasin de vente de charbon bois à côté du marché de sa localité.Il parvient à générer des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à certains besoins de sa femmes et de ses trois enfants.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 400 000f pour acheter 200 sacs de charbon de bois.
texts.en: Daouda is a married man. He tends a store selling charcoal beside the market of his locale. He manages to generate income that allows him to meet some of the needs of his wife and three children. In order to strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan of 400,000f to buy 200 bags of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy 200 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sarah Y.

texts.en: Sarah, 45, is a mother of five children between the ages of 18 and 28. Four of her children live outside of her home and are independent. Only one of them stays with her at home, and is currently attending the university. Sarah stopped her education in the ninth grade. She resides with her husband at Jacob Town community. For the past ten years she has been selling coal, soft drinks, washing soap, bath soap, and many other items. One difficulty she faces is low sales during the rainy season. She makes a profit when she sells because her soft drinks are always cool and quench her customers' thirst. She also has what her customers need. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal, soft drinks, and bath soap for the business. Her dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more coal, soft drinks, and bath soap for resale

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Mbaye est un homme marié, père de quatre enfants.Il tient un magasin de vente de téléphone portables et d'accessoires.Les revenus générés par cette activité lui permettent de subvenir à certains besoins de sa famille. Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500000f afin d'acheter des accessoires de téléphones portables.
texts.en: Mbaye is a married man, father to four children. He tends a store selling cell phones and accessories. The income generated by this business allows him to meet some of his family's needs. To strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan of 500,000f in order to buy cell phone accessories.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Maguatte

texts.fr: Maguatte est un homme marié, père de 5 enfants. Il vend des tissus depuis plus de 20 ans au marché central de sa localité.Avec l'aide de son fils ainé, il entretien sa famille avec les revenus tirés de son commerce. Il sollicite un pret de 350 000f pour acheter des tissus afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce.
texts.en: Maguatte is a married man, father to 5 children. He has been selling fabric for more than 20 years at the central market of his locale. With the help of his oldest son, he takes care of his family with the income generated by his business. He is requesting a loan of 350,000f to buy fabric in order to strengthen his business.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Con 34 años de edad Maximiliana lleva una linda relación conyugal con Adrián de 44 años, como principal complemento de su alegría familiar tiene a sus dos pequeños hijas Loida y Raquel para quienes dirige todo su trabajo y esfuerzo, comparten sus vivencias familiares en una vivienda hecha a base de bloques de adobe.
Desarrolla conjuntamente con su pareja una de las actividades mas productivas de la zona consistente en el mantenimiento de cacao orgánico. Tiene la suerte de contar con unas parcelas muy productivas en cuanto a calidad de suelo que aporta de manera considerable en las ganancias finales que percibe, no obstante para llevar a cabo un buen mantenimiento debe seguir una serie de pasos que recibe por parte de una institución del rubro productivo de cacao.
Hace poco realizó la remolición de una gran parte de sus cultivos para incrementar la productividad de sus parcelas esperando para la próxima temporada obtener una mejor rentabilidad. 
Planea dividir sus parcelas en dos sectores una de las cuales será de puro cacao orgánico para el cual desea adquirir plantas de cacao o almácigo así como los sacos de abono orgánico , adicional a ello debe contratar la mano de obra de 10 jornaleros del lugar para apoyar en las labores de sembrío y mantenimiento.
Desea seguir trabajando con la misma motivación de siempre ya que su objetivo es incrementar aun más la dimensión de sus parcelas con la compra de otros terrenos colindantes que sus vecinos planean comercializárselas a futuro.
Por tanto debe solicitar 2,000 soles para la compra de plantas de almácigo, abono orgánico, así como contratar jornaleros para el desempeño de las respectivas tareas de mantenimiento a sus árboles de cacao.
texts.en:
Maximiliana, age 34, has a beautiful marriage with Adrián, age 44.  The main additions to her family happiness are her two little daughters, Loida and Raquel.  It is for them that she devotes all of her work and effort.  They share their housing with relatives in a house made from adobe blocks.

Together with her life partner she engages in one of the most productive business activities in the area, the upkeep of organic cacao crops.  She is lucky to have some land that is very productive.  The quality of the soil contributes considerably to the final income that she gets.  Even so, in order to carry out good maintenance, she needs to follow a series of steps that she got from an institution in the field of cacao production.

A little while ago she reconditioned a large part of her crops in order to increase her land’s productivity.  She did this in the hope of getting greater profitability during the next season.

She plans to divide her land into two parts.  One part will be for pure, organic cacao.  It is for this part that she wishes to get cacao plants or seedlings and sacks of organic fertilizer.  She also needs to hire ten day workers to help with the planting and maintenance work.

She wishes to continue working with the same motivation as always.  This is because her objective is to increase, even more, the dimensions of her land buy purchasing other adjoining land that her neighbors plan to sell in the future.

Therefore, she needs to request 2,000 soles to buy seedlings, organic fertilizer, and to hire day workers to do the maintenance work on her cacao trees.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, organic fertilizer, and to hire day workers.

loans.name: Mukokoma Bakyara Group

texts.en:
Sarah, the chairperson of Mukokoma Bakyara group operates a stall of mixed food items such as plantain and vegetables among others in Lyantonde central market. She used her previous loan to buy a stall of her own and is now able to use the money previously used to pay rent to buy more stock. She will now buy more items to sell so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers. 

As the group chairperson she strives hard to pay well and expand her business, and to live and act as an example to other women in the group, especially whenever she gets a new loan.  She is very hardworking and confesses that the loan has helped the women in the group to be self-sufficient without having to depend on their husbands for everything.

loans.use: To buy food items for sell.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno, 48, lives with her family: husband and six children, and runs a store where she sells essential items such as basic grains, beverages, snacks and other products. The store is located in her home and is very well-known because she is a good salesperson and sells quality products at low prices. Luvuno is very dedicated to her work and is always looking for ways to prosper. She wants to stay ahead of the competition and invest in her business, but she is in need of capital. Therefore, she has requested a loan from Yehu to buy basic grains, instant products, sweets, bread, beverages, detergents, etc.

Luvuno is able to make payments on her loan and has a good credit record. She is happy to receive the support and is confident she can pay back the loan on time, while giving her family the more fulfilling life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant products, sweets, bread, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Mutaraza Kwebisaho Group

texts.en:
Jovailo is a 49-year-old divorcee with four children. Since she divorced her husband who later died, Jovailo needs income to boost her business in order to help her look after her children so that they can have a better future. She conducts business on a small scale. Her main challenges are price fluctuations, unpredictable seasons and dishonest clients who buy goods on credit and never pay.

Evas, another group member, wants to buy more goats to trade as well as beans, maize, nuts and bananas. Her husband is unemployed, so she is the one looking after the family. Price fluctuations and foot-and-mouth disease are her major challenges.
  
The women are grateful to Ugafode and the group for having helped them to be independent in terms of finance. They are now doing well, and their children and families are well cared for thanks to sensitization received through the group.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is a 24-year-old woman from San Jose, Talibon, Bohol. She has been making a living through her sari-sari, or variety store, business for more than two years now. 

Eugenie is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell in the market, such as canned goods, noodles, soap, toiletries, snack foods and chips. With this, she will be able to cater to more buyers and customers in her store, thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in the market, such as canned goods, noodles, soap, toiletries, snack foods and chips.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en: Analou is 37 years old and the mother of two young children who lives in Talibon, Bohol. She has earned a living for the last three years by running a sari-sari (or variety) store. She works hard to help her husband meet the needs of their family, and is asking for a loan to buy additional items to sell to her customers, including noodles, biscuits and other snack foods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries. This loan will allow her to attract  more customers into her store. In the future, Analou dreams of expanding her business and saving money to pay for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen is 52 years old, married and lives in Talibon, Bohol. She earns a living by selling drinks and other refreshments to people who live in her area. She has been in this business for almost 30 years and is applying for a loan to renovate her house. She will use the loan to buy cement, galvanized iron and nails. She will also use a portion of the loan to expand her business. Her goal is to earn enough money to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate her house, including cement, galvanized iron and nails

loans.name: Maricela Del Rocio

texts.es:
Maricela es una mujer joven de 20 años, terminó la secundaria, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 3 años, para ella ha sido muy difícil educar sola a su hijo, pero él se ha convertido en la inspiración de cada día para salir adelante en su trabajo. Viven en Pastaza, un cantón ubicado en la Provincia con el mismo nombre, perteneciente a la Región Amazónica de la República del Ecuador. La cabecera cantonal es la ciudad del Puyo una ciudad ubicada en medio de la selva amazónica al occidente de la provincia de Pastaza y a 924 m. sobre el nivel del mar. Es demográficamente pequeña pero tiene una gran variedad de sitios que son los preferidos para turistas nacionales e internacionales sobre todo los de actividades ecológicas y de deportes extremos. Una ciudad que crece económicamente cada día por las actividades de comercio, ganadería, agricultura y turismo, por lo que en ella se han establecido sucursales de empresas financieras y comerciales que pretenden aprovechar la actividad económica que mantiene esta ciudad. En cada negocio se encuentra personas que no se han dado por vencidas frente a la falta de empleo sino que han emprendido con sus ideas de negocio para llevar una vida digna y hacer realidad sus sueños.
Maricela emprendió con la venta de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante cuando quedó embarazada, es decir hace alrededor de 4 años. La posibilidad de continuar estudiando se había desvanecido, primero por los escasos recursos económicos y después por la llegada de su hijo. Sin embargo a pesar de los obstáculos ha salido adelante con su vida. Trabaja diez horas cada día, su trabajo consiste en clasificar, limpiar y vender las frutas y verduras que ofrece, en sus salidas se ubica en lugares estratégicos de barrios en donde las amas de casa realizan sus compras. Aprendió este negocio de sus padres y ahora lo administra muy  bien. En esta temporada aparecen en el mercado frutas tropicales como ciruela y mango que son muy demandadas por los clientes. Es por eso que Maricela requiere un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con una cantidad de estas frutas y así recaudar más ingresos para ofrecer a su hijo un estilo de vida digno y además mantener un ahorro que en el futuro pueda invertirlo en la educación de su hijo y así poder darle la profesión que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de conseguir. Maricela agradece a Fundación Alternativa quienes con agilidad y confianza le otorgaron el crédito y además la asesoría para llevar una buena administración y presentación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Maricela is a 20-year-old young woman.  She finished secondary school.  She's single and has a child, age 3.  It has been very hard for her to raise her child alone, but he has become an inspiration every day for her to get ahead in her job.

They live in Pastaza, a canton located in the province of the same name, in the Amazon region of the Republic of Ecuador.  The canton seat is the city of Puyo, located in the middle of the Amazon jungle in the west of Pastaza Province at 924 meters above sea level.  Demographically it's small, but there's a wide variety of sites preferred by Ecuadorian and international tourists, especially for ecological and extreme sports activities.

It's a city that grows economically every day because of commerce, livestock, agriculture, and tourism.  For this reason branches of banks and businesses have been established to make the most of the economic activity here.  In every business there are people who, faced with the lack of jobs, have not given up but rather have undertaken ideas for businesses to have a decent life and make their dreams come true.

Maricela started selling fruits and vegetables on foot when she was pregnant, about four years ago.  The possibility of continuing to study had disappeared, first because of her scarce financial resources and then because of the arrival of her child.  Nevertheless, in spite of the obstacles, she has gotten ahead with her life.  She works ten hours every day.  Her job consists of sorting, cleaning, and selling fruits and vegetables.  When she goes out to sell she stays in strategic locations in neighborhoods where housewives shop.  She learned this business from her parents and now manages it very well.  

In this season, tropical fruits such as plums and mangos appear in the market and are in high demand among her customers.  This is why Maricela needs a loan to stock her business with a quantity of these fruits and earn more income to give her son decent lifestyle.  She  also wants to maintain savings she can use in the future for her son's education, to give him a profession, which she herself didn't have the opportunity to have.

Maricela is grateful to Fundación Alternativa, which adroitly and trustingly gave her the loan and the counseling to manage and carry out her business well.

loans.use: to buy plums and mangos

loans.name: Rosalina Alejandra

texts.es: Rosalina de  55 anos de edad, madre soltera con cinco hijos mayores de  edad de la localidad de León, Lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La actividad económica de Rosalina es la venta de chinelas para mujer, niños, hombres y zapatos de tela, desde hace 19 anos que desempeña dicha actividad. el negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de trabajo para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Rosalina ha demostrado su responsabilidad a de pago en los créditos anteriores. El objetivo del crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de chinelas de varon, chinela de ninos, de mujer, zapatos de tela.Rosalina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Rosalina, 55, is a single mother of five children, who are independent, in the city of León. León is in the west of the country. Rosalind sells flip-flops for women, children and men, and shoes made of fabric. She’s been running this business for 19 years. The idea for this business came about as a result of needing a source of income to help out with expenses at home. Rosalind has shown herself to be responsible in repaying previous loans. The objective of this loan is to invest in business capital and stock her business with flip-flops for women, children and men, and shoes made of fabric. Rosalind is grateful for the help Kiva investors offer those of few resources -- and poor countries like Nicaragua -- so that they can have a dignified work environment.

loans.use: invest in business capital and stock her business with flip-flops for men, children and women, and shoes made of fabric.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a Ghanaian artisan who makes hand-carved wood masks and sculptures. Abdul would like to invest in the purchase of wood and other materials that he uses to create his authentic African masks.

Abdul has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"I always knew I wanted to paint but wasn't sure I could make a living out of it, so I looked into other fields too. I observed master carver Musa at his workshop for a period of time, then I picked up a log of wood and started carving out a mask as I had observed him doing. This surprised Musa, and he was willing to help me perfect the skill. I developed a love for this new art, and that's how I eventually became a master carver too! I am now able to share this skill with others who I teach to carve."  

"Thanks to the first micro-credit you granted me, I was able to bring in other wood carvers to assist me. Now, I'd like to stock up on materials to continue creating my masks. I thank you very much for your assistance with this micro-loan!"

Use the link below to view Abdul's hand-carved wood masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7253

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood and other materials that he uses to create his authentic African masks.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is 25 years old. She has one child. 

She earns her income through farming. She grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, sweet potatoes, and pineapples. She also keeps sheep, chickens and pigs. 

Scovia looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes.  She needs to buy the business-in-a-box.

With the additional money that she will earn as a CKW, Scovia will invest in her farming business. She dreams of improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, de 41 años, es una mujer  alegre, soñadora y emprendedora. Esta separada de conviviente, vive en la casa de sus padres junto con su hijo de 8 años a quien quiere dar una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Jesús consiste en la venta de bebidas gasificadas como cervezas de diferentes marcas y gaseosas de distintos sabores, asimismo golosinas como galletas, chocolates, caramelos, y helados de frutas como fresa, coco, piña, entre otros. Realiza la venta de  sus productos en un local en el interior de la vivienda de sus padres. Lleva 3 años en esta actividad. Comenta que empezó a realizar esta actividad por la falta de empleo y decidió generar ingresos económicos propios, para solventar los gastos del hogar. Cuenta con la ayuda de sus padres para preparar los distintos helados y para la compra de las bebidas gasificadas. Considera rentable su negocio porque su local esta ubicado en un lugar  muy transitado por personas de toda la ciudad las cuales consumen los productos que tiene al venta. Comenta que antes de realizar esta actividad no contaba con un capital para iniciar un negocio propio. Entonces tomo la decisión de hacer un préstamo y contar un capital de respaldo. Espera en el futuro incrementar la  producción de sus helados para que su negocio siga creciendo.  Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 3  con la institución MFP, tiene ganas de seguir siendo puntual en su cuotas, porque le esta yendo muy bien. Además  su grupo la motiva para que siga adelante en su negocio.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas gasificadas como cervezas de diferentes marcas y gaseosas de distintos sabores. También comprará golosinas  como galletas, chocolates, caramelos, etc. y adquirirá frutas como fresa, coco, piña, entre otros.
texts.en:
Jesús, 41 years old, is a happy, idealistic and enterprising woman. She is separated from her partner and lives in the home of her parents together with her 8 year old child to whom she would like to give a good education and a better quality of life.

Jesús' work consists in the sale of fizzy drinks like beer of different brands and soda of various flavors. In the same way she sells sweets such as cookies, chocolates, caramels and fruit ice cream such as strawberry. coconut and pineapple, among other flavors. She sells her products in a locale inside the home of her parents. She has been running this business for 3 years. She comments that she started this business because of the lack of jobs and decided to generate her own income, to settle the expenses of the home. She counts on the help of her parents to prepare the various ice creams and for the purchase of the fizzy drinks. She considers her business profitable because her locale is located in a place that is much traveled by people from the whole city who consume the products that she sells. She comments that before starting this business she did not have the capital to start her own business. Thus she made the decision to take a loan and count on the capital help.

She hopes in the future to increase the production of her ice creams so that her business continues to grow. So this will be her loan number 3 with the MFP institution. She wants to continue being punctual with her payments, because things are going very well for her. As well her group motivates her so that she gets ahead with her business. With the amount requested, 1000 soles, she will invest in the purchase of fizzy drinks such as beer of different brands and sodas of various flavors. She will also buy sweets such as cookies, chocolates, caramels, etc. and will acquire fruits such as strawberries, coconuts and pineapples, among others.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks such as beer of different brands and sodas of various flavors. She will also buy sweets such as cookies, chocolates, caramels, etc. and will acquire fruits such as strawberries, coconuts and pineapples, among others.

loans.name: Andrey

texts.ru:
Андрей торгует на авторынке, продает автозапчасти к российским автомобилям ВАЗ, Москвич и Волга.
Андрей порядочный, вежливый, ответственный и трудолюбивый. Он регулярно осуществляет поездки за товаром для пополнения ассортимента. Андрей уже не раз пользовался бизнес кредитами, которые помогают ему поддерживать бизнес на хорошем уровне. В этот раз кредит понадобился для закупки автозапчастей для автомобилей ВАЗ: проводва, свечи, оптика, коврики, освежители, радиаторы, и др.
texts.en: Andrey is a vendor selling automotive spare parts for Russian-made cars, such as VAZ, Moskvitch and Volga at the automotive market. He is trustworthy, polite, responsible and hard-working. He regularly makes trips to buy merchandise for his stock. He has already taken out several loans, which allows him to maintain his business at a good level. This time he needs a loan in order to buy spare parts for VAZ cars: wires, spark plugs, lights, mats, fresheners, grills, etc.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for Russian-made VAZ cars,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an electric oven, flour, eggs and milk.

loans.name: Rosalia Ramona

texts.es: Rosalía de 37 anos de edad, casada sin hijos, del departamento de león, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. León se caracteriza por ser un lugar con gente muy acogedora, servicial, trabajadora. Rosalía tiene por actividad económica la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 15 anos que de dedica  a dicha actividad. La rutina diaria de Rosalía es trabajar unas 8 horas diarias de forma ambulante con una pana en la cabeza ofreciendo sus frutas y verduras. Ella ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con verduras y frutas como: naranjas, tomates, chiltomas, papaya, pina, cálala, ayote, chayote, y de dicha forma aprovechar las ventas por la temporada navideña. Rosalía agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Rosalía, 37, is married and has no children.  She’s from León Department, a place located in the western part of the country.  León is noted for being a place with welcoming, helpful, hardworking people.  Rosalía’s economic activity is selling fruit and vegetables; she’s been in this business for 15 years.  Her daily routine is to work 8 hours going from place to place with a basket on her head selling her fruit and vegetables.

She has worked with the Fundación previously and has been responsible and made her payments as required.  The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with vegetables and fruit like oranges, tomatoes, peppers, papayas, pineapples, passion fruit, squash and chayote to be ready for the Christmas season this way.  Rosalía is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that ways of earning a living with dignity are possible.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Xochilt Maria

texts.es: Xochilt de 30 anos de edad, casada con dos hijos de 7 y 3 anos los cuales asisten a clases al colegio de la localidad. Ella es originaria del municipio de Nagarote, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Xochilt tiene por actividad económica una ferretería ubicada en un lugar especifico de la localidad, el negocio consiste en vender materiales de construcción como , tornillos, tubo pc, alambres, bisagras, martillos, serruchos, llaves de pase, candados, alicates, palas, carretillas. Ella tiene 7 anos de tener el negocio. Xochilt ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para obtener más clientela y mejores ingresos. Xochilt agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Xochilt, 30, is married and has two children who are 7 and 3 years of age and attend a local school.  She’s from the municipality of Nagarote, a place located in the western part of the country.  Xochilt’s economic activity is a hardware store located in a specific place in town; it consists in selling building materials and supplies like screws, pc tubing, wires, hinges, hammers, saws, wrenches, padlocks, pliers, shovels, wheelbarrows, etc.  She’s been in business 7 years and has been responsible with payments making them as scheduled.  The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and tock her business to acquire more customers and higher income.  Xochilt is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that ways of earning a living with dignity are possible.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her hardware store.

loans.name: Los Nardos Group

texts.es: Doña Bertha tiene 42 años de edad ella es integrante de un grupo llamado Los Nardos y aunque llevan poco tiempo como integrantes de un grupo para pedir créditos dice que todos se llevan bien y que se ayudan entre sí, si alguien no tiene para cubrir todo el pago de su crédito. Ella desde hace mas de 20 años tiene un puesto junto con su esposo de tlapalería donde venden talachos, martillos, desarmadores de diferentes medidas, taladros, tubos de silicón, clavos, tornillos, serruchos, brochas etc. Dice que su puesto lo tiene afuera de la central de abastos y que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificios se los dieron ya que mucha gente pelea ese tipo de puestos ya que están cerca de la central camionera y se vende muy bien. Dice que como no tenían un trabajo estable ella y su esposo pusieron su negocio, primero vendían pintura para zapatos, cremas, agujetas y después la misma gente le fue diciendo que surtiera más cosas como desarmadores, tornillos y muchas cosas mas entonces dice que junto un dinerito y se fue a surtir a la ciudad de México donde venden todo tipo de herramientas y cosas que se venden en las tlapalerías y decidió hacer crecer su negocio, dice que ahorita está pidiendo un crédito a Visión Fund para mejorar su puesto y que quiere hacerlo crecer comprando unos paquetes con herramientas que vio y quiere comprar una lona por que la que tiene esta deteriorada por las inclemencias del clima. Dice que a los créditos que ha pedido a la financiera ha mejorado las condiciones de su negocio y de su familia y que su meta es poner un puesto más amplio. Los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman Alicia, Olivia, Leonel, Priscila, Rosa Ma., Ma. Guadalupe y Juana ellos invertirán en sus negocios como surtir de frutas y legumbres de temporada para su venta, para surtir ropa interior para su venta, compra de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas de maíz y para la compra de artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Bertha, 42, is a member of the group called “Los Nardos” and although they’ve only been in a group to request loans for a short period of time she says they all get along well and help each other out if someone doesn’t quite have enough to cover the entire loan payment.  

For more than 20 years, she and her husband have had a hardware stand where they sell picks, hammers, screwdrivers in various sizes, drills, silicon tubes, nails, screws, saws, paint brushes, etc.  She says that she has the stand outside the wholesale food market and that they were given it with much effort and sacrifice because many people compete for this type of stand because being near the central bus station sales are very good.  She says that because they had no jobs, she and her husband set up their business.  

At first they sold paint for shoes, shoe polish and shoe laces and then the people themselves suggested they start to stock things like screwdrivers, screws and many other things so she says she saved up a little money and went to Mexico City to stock up because all sorts of hardware and things sold in hardware stores are sold there; she decided to make her business grow and says that she’s now asking Vision Fund for a loan to improve her stand.  She wants to make it grow by buying some packages of hardware she saw and she wants to buy a tarpaulin because the one they have is deteriorated because of the weather.  She says that the loans she’s asked the financial institution have improved her business and her family conditions and now her goal is to have a larger stand.

The other group members’ names are Alicia, Olivia, Leonel, Priscila, Rosa María, María Guadalupe and Juana and they will invest in their various businesses like stocking up on seasonal fruit and vegetables to sell, stocking up on underwear to sell, buying corn to make corn tortillas and buying stock merchandise for a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy hardware.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes de 44 anos de edad, madres soltera con dos hijos de 22, 15 anos de edad, originaria del departamento de León, lugar que  esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa variada como pantalones, vestidos, faldas, ropa de niño, cosméticos, ella tiene 13 anos de desempeñar dicha actividad. La rutina diaria de María Mercedes es trabajar unas 10 horas diario de forma ambulante  con un peso de unos 20 kg con productos que ofrece a sus clientes fijos y eventuales. Ella ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. el objetivo del préstamo es par invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir de mercadería su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y aprovechar la temporada navideña que las ventas se incrementan. María Mercedes agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: María Mercedes is 44 years old and is a single mother of two children, ages 22 and 15. She is a native of León, Nicaragua, which is located in the western part of the country. She has made a living selling a variety of clothing, such as pants, suits and dresses, skirts, baby clothes and cosmetics, for 13 years. She works 10 hours a day, going from place to place with some 20 kilograms (44 pounds) of products to offer her regular and soon-to-be customers. She already has worked with this institution and has demonstrated responsibility making her payments on time. Her goal for this loan is to increase her working capital and to stock up on supplies to satisfy her customers' demands and take advantage of Christmastime, when sales increase. María Mercedes is grateful for the help Kiva lenders have provided to people with few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they have a means to dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase pants, suits and dresses, skirts, baby clothes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Irma Marina

texts.es: Irma de  32 anos de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos menores de edad  de 14, 10,6 anos. Irma es originaria del Sauce lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país. Irma tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdo desde hace 6 anos, negocio que esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingreso para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Irma ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo  y forma en los créditos anteriores. El objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de un lote de cerdos para la crianza y venta. Irma agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Irma is 32 years old and the single mother of three children, ages 14, 10, and 6.  Irma is originally from Sauce, a place located in the northern area of the country.  Irma has been raising and selling pigs out of her home for six years.  She started this business because she needed a source of income to be able to help with the household expenses.

Irma has proven her responsibility to repay her previous loans on time.  Her objective for this loan is to invest in her business by buying land and pigs to rise and sell.  Irma is grateful to the Kiva investors who help people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they will have sources of dignified work.

loans.use: to buy land and pigs.

loans.name: Los Encinos Group

texts.es: Ricarda es una mujer trabajadora tiene 44 años de edad y es viuda, ella es parte del grupo Los Encinos Ganadería, dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo porque donde viven se da mucho los arboles de encino y lo de ganadería por que la mayoría de las integrantes se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino, vacuno y bovino. Dice que a raíz de que su marido falleció ella tuvo que hacerse cargo sola de sus hijos ya que en aquel tiempo los tres estudiaban, dice que ahorita dos de sus hijas trabajan en la ciudad de México como empleadas domesticas y ellas son las que le ayudan a sacar adelante a su hijo el cual estudia la preparatoria  con muchos sacrificios.
