texts.fr: Madame Aby est une femme mariée qui vit dans une localité sénégalaise, elle est mère de 9 enfants. Elle évolue depuis plus de six ans dans le secteur du commerce et exerce la vente de tissus et sacs. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et sacs destinés a la vente. Elle souhaite aussi diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise en intégrant d’autres articles pour femmes. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices pour pouvoir mieux assister sa famille et satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Son vœu est de disposer d’un grand magasin de vente de tissus, d’écharpes, de sacs.
texts.en:
Aby is a married woman who lives in a town in Senegal. She has nine children.

Aby shifted into the retail sector over six years ago. She sells fabric and bags. She is a member of a branch of the UIMCEC, and she is seeking a 300,000 frs loan in order to buy fabric and bags to resell. She also wants to diversify the products that she sells by incorporating other feminine items.

Her objective is to increase her profits so that she can better care for her family and cover her own personal needs. Her dream is to have a big store where she can sell fabric, scarfs, and bags.

loans.use: to buy fabric, bags, and other feminine items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 70kg of chemical fertilizer and pay labourers

loans.name: Dusangirimirimo Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Philemon est membre du groupe solidaire DUSANGIRIMIRIMO.  Son activité principale est l’agriculture du riz. La dite activité est celle qui est financée. A part de l’activité financée, il fait aussi le petit commerce.
Agé de 46 ans, il est marié et a 6 enfants dont le plus âgé a 20 ans et le moins âgé a 3 ans. Cinq de ses enfants vont à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge.
Il est né au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 8 ans de l’école primaire.
Il a débuté de collaborer avec ACB Ltd depuis 2011 et actuellement est au 3ème cycle de crédit. Les deux premiers cycles sont bien remboursés.
Avec le crédit sollicité, il va acheter 40 kilos d’engrais chimiques et paiera la main d’œuvre avec la partie qui reste. 
N’envisageant aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt, Monsieur Philemon va travailler avec toute sa force pour accroitre son activité agricole.  Il a l’ambition d’être le grand cultivateur du riz dans toute la région. Pour sa famille, il va éduquer ses enfants et les fera soigner.
texts.en:
Philemon is a member of the Dusangirimirimo solidarity group. His main business is rice farming, and this is the business for which he is seeking finance. He is also a small-scale trader.

Philemon is 46 years old, married and the father of six. His eldest child is 20, and the youngest three. Five of his children are in school, and he has no one else to look after. He was born in Rwanda and completed eight years of primary school.

Philemon started working with ACB S.A. in 2011 and is currently on his third loan cycle. The previous two loans were correctly repaid.

With the loan requested, he will purchase 40 kilograms of chemical fertilizer. The remainder will be used to pay his labourers. He does not foresee any difficulties repaying this loan, and will work as hard as possible to expand his agricultural business. 

Philemon's ambition is to become the region’s largest rice grower. At home, is aims are to educate his children and ensure they are well looked after.

loans.use: purchase 40kgs of chemical fertilizer and pay labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 60kgs of chemical fertilizer and pay labourers.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 32 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Gina has been raising livestock for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut wine.

Gina is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.fr: Mercy est une femme célibataire qui vit dans un quartier de la capitale. Mère d'un enfant, elle gère un salon de coiffure dont elle est propriétaire. Grace à la maîtrise de son activité  et à son dynamisme, elle s'est faite une grande clientèle dont elle aimerait continuer d'assurer la satisfaction. Pour cela elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des produits de beauté. Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront d'augmenter son capital et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mercy is single and lives in a neighbourhood of the capital. She has one child. 

Mercy manages a hairdressing salon that she owns. Thanks to her excellent business skills and dynamism, she has built up a large clientele, which she would like to continue to serve well. In order to do this, she has requested this loan to purchase beauty products. The profits made using this loan will enable her to increase her capital and meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes ahead of the Christmas season when demand is high.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's group is composed of three hardworking women. Irene is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past four years, Irene has been working hard to manage her small restaurant business, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food that will be cooked for resale. This will help Irene to generate greater profits and increase her capital to buy needed items for the restaurant. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more food that will be cooked for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise to sell, such as soap and salt.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, 1 of whom is currently in school. For the past 4 years, Joan has been working hard to manage her small hotel that sells cooked food.

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 800000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more fresh food for cooking and reselling, and will help Joan to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Joan hopes that in the future she will be able to to become a rich business woman. 

Joan is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food to cook and resell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Joan has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 500000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food for cooking and reselling. It will also help Joan to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. Joan hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a bigger restaurant. 

Joan is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food for cooking and reselling.

loans.name: Delys

texts.es: Delys compró muchos productos de belleza y acondicionó su local con su previo credikiva, en la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo finaciamiento porque la temporada de Diciembre viene con mucho pedidos y su capital de trabajo resulta ser insuficiente para comprar productos de belleza como insumos para ofrecer servicios de mejoramiento de imagen en su sala de belleza y tambien para la venta; esta es la razón por la cual acude aun nuevo credikiva con el que comprará champoo, productos capilares, cosméticos cremas etc.
texts.en: Delys bought several beauty products and renovated her salon with her previous Kiva loan. She's currently applying for a new loan because December is approaching with a lot of orders and her working capital is not enough to purchase beauty products. She'll use them to offer beauty enhancement services at her beauty salon, and also for selling. That's the reason why she seeks a new Kiva loan, which she'll use to purchase shampoo, hair products, cosmetics, lotions, etc.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, hair products, cosmetics, lotions, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 60kgs of chemical fertilizer and pay labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay labourers.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 22 years old and lives in the Telavi district with his wife and child. He earns an income as a taxi driver and provides services to local people. George's income is not enough to provide food for a three-person family and, according to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. George has decided to start a new business to supplement his income but his loan requests have been rejected several times by local financial institutions. He lacks experience with new business start-ups and does not qualify under income requirements. 

George is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to many credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. George will use his loan to start a car wash.  He will purchase essential equipment and a vacuum cleaner. George will provide services to local community members and hopes to increase the monthly income of the family. His new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to start a car wash and purchase essential equipment and a vacuum cleaner

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his grocery store

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a 28-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. Maureen operates a beauty salon and has been able to buy land and pay school fees for her children with the income she has earned. She does not have adequate capital to purchase modern equipment to attract more customers.

Maureen is requesting a loan to buy synthetic hair and cosmetics for her salon. In the future, her dream is to modernize her salon and diversify her business to include farming.

loans.use: to buy synthetic hair and cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a 54-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. For the past 26 years, Innocent has been a teacher. He was inspired to become a teacher by his love of associating with young people. Innocent's major financial challenge is his low salary as he is unable to fully meet his daily expenses.

Innocent is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children. In the future, he plans to venture into business to supplement his salary.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for his children

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is 39 years old, married and lives in Kobuleti district with her husband and three children (14, 18 and 21 years old). Her husband works as a salesman and gets a monthly salary. Inga’s economic activity is a newly started small grocery store, where she sells different kinds of groceries. Inga requested a loan from local financial institutions for the business expansion, but without success. Her loan request was rejected because of her low income and insufficient experience in her business. 

However, her loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The program provides start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. They do not have access to traditional credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. Inga requested a loan to purchase basic groceries that customers often request. She plans to increase the turnover in her trade business gradually. This will raise the income of the family, which will be used to improve the family’s living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase basic groceries for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food to sell.

loans.name: Kyanya Bakyara Thuwathikana Group

texts.en: Eddy is a fifty-two-year-old married woman with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a retail business for twenty-two years and she has been able to buy land for farming with the proceeds. She began her business to be economically empowered. Inadequate capital and price fluctuations are her major challenges, while her dreams are to have a wholesale shop and venture into commercial farming. Eddy intends to use this loan to purchase soap and palm oil to sell. She is a member of the above-mentioned group, in which each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to purchase soap and palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 42 years old, married and lives in Tbilisi with her husband and three children (11,17 and 21 years old). The younger children go to the local school. Nana’s economic activity is a newly started small store, where she sells different kinds of fruits and vegetables. Nana requested a loan from local financial institutions to expand her business, but without success. Her loan request was rejected because of her low income and insufficient experience in her business. 

However, her loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The program provides start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. These people do not have access to traditional credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Nana requested a loan purchase coffee grinder and coffee. She will sell coffee and offer grinding services to her clients. Nana plans to increase the turnover in her trade business gradually. This will raise the income of the family, which she will use to improve the family’s living conditions and finance the education of her child. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and a coffee grinder.

loans.name: Leyne

texts.es: Leyne desde San Juan Nepomuceno está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con Kiva, pues va a prepararse para las fiestas de fin de año, época de gran movimiento comercial y en la que usualmente hace la mejor venta del año, pero sus recursos se encuentran en sus cuentas por cobrar, en manos de la clientela que le compra a crédito. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un creikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa exterior interior y calzado informal; ella está muy segura de sus resultados positivos, al hacer esta inversión,  porque responderá a la demanda de sus clientes a los que mucho conoce, porque pertenecen a la misma población donde habita y tiene su negocio  desde hace 2 años, el cual nació  con el objetivo de generar ingresos; inició vendiendo mercancías variadas y esta actividad le ha funcionado como fuente de recursos para sostenerse a sus 20 años y resolver sus necesidades básicas y futuros sueños.  En la puerta de su casa tiene una pequeña vitrina, con la  que llama la atención de la gente, logrando que se acerque a comprar artículos varios, pero ella  principalmente vende ropa y calzado,  que compra en las ciudades de Barranquilla ciudad costera a 3 horas de su natal San Juan Nepomuceno y en la capital de Colombia : Bogotá. Sus clientes le pagan principalmente a crédito y muchas veces de contado, cuando por ejemplo son artículos más económicos, como la ropa interior. Su meta es continuar sus estudios,  pero más inmediatamente aumentar sus ventas,  para poder responder a esta necesidad y al sueño de algún día ser una profesional prestigiosa.
texts.en:
Leyne, who is from San Juan Nepomuceno, is applying for her first loan with Kiva to be ready for the year-end events that usually generate the highest sales of the year for businesses. Her working capital, though, is tied up in accounts receivable. She is seeking her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy clothing, underwear, and casual shoes. She is certain this investment will be successful because she will be meeting the needs of her regular customers, who live in the neighborhood where she has operated her business for two years. 

At age 20, she started selling a variety of merchandise to earn income, and the business funds her daily needs and her dreams for the future. There is a small display case in the doorway of her house to attract customers to buy her merchandise. Mostly, Leyne sells clothing and shoes that she buys in the coastal city of  Barranquilla, which is three hours from her native San Juan Nepomuceno, and in Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. Her customers usually pay on credit; sometimes they pay in cash for cheaper items such as underwear. Right now she wants to increase her sales, but her goal is to continue her education so that one day she can achieve her dream to have a prestigious career.

loans.use: to buy clothing, underwear, and casual shoes.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna de 32 años, natural del distrito de Santa Rosa. Tiene por pareja a Zacarías padre de sus  3 menores hijos con quienes comparte muchas vivencias y juntos habitan en una calida vivienda hecha a base de madera. Durante muchos años se desempeñó como productora de cacao orgánico, pero al sufrir un temporal ataque de plagas se vio en la necesidad de abrir un nuevo negocio que es la crianza de aves de corral.
Lleva 1 año desempeñándose en el rubro y tras la venta de su primera crianza se siente muy motivada ya que las aves alcanzaron un buen tamaño. Le agrada mucho esta actividad debido a que siente tener una comprensión única con las aves y es algo sencillo con relación al duro trabajo en el campo y porque no requiere contar con mano de obra adicional logrando así obtener buenas ganancias.
Desea iniciar nuevamente con la crianza para su segunda temporada para el cual requiere adquirir gallinitas bebe y sacos de alimento natural con el cual espera brindarles toda la atención posible y repetir la primera buena crianza.
Siente que lo suyo es la crianza de animales es por ello que a futuro esta optando por dedicarse a la crianza de vacas y otros. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, muy agradecida se compromete a cumplir fielmente con el pago de sus cuotas para a futuro acceder a un crédito mayor. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de gallinitas de corral así como reservar dinero para la compra de granos de maíz para la constante alimentación de las aves.
texts.en:
Reyna, 32, is from Santa Rosa District.  Her partner is Zacarías, the father of their three minor children she shares many life experiences with and who all live together in a cozy house made of Wood.  For many years she worked growing organic cocoa beans but when the crops were attacked by a seasonal pest infestation she had go into a new business: raising barnyard fowl.

She’s been in this line of work for a year and after selling her first batch of animals she feels motivated because the birds attained good growth.  She likes this activity very much because she feels she has a unique understanding of the birds and it’s somewhat easier than the hard field work she used to do and she also does not have to hire additional staff so her profits are good.

She wants to start raising a new group for the second season and needs to buy baby chicks and sacks of natural feed to provide them with the all the care necessary and repeat her initial good results.  She feels that her calling is raising animals which is why in future she wants to go into raising cows and others.

This is her first MFP loan and she’s very grateful and commits to faithfully make her payments so that she can access a larger loan in future.  She will use the 1,000 new soles to buy barnyard fowl chicks and also set aside some of the money to buy grains of corn for the constant feeding of the fowl.

loans.use: to buy chickens and corn.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna, de 42 años, es una mujer cordial y emprendedora. Vive en la casa de su mamá junto a sus 3 hijos de 23, 20 y 15 años, quienes están estudiando para tener un futuro mejor. El trabajo de Reyna consiste en la preparación de helados de  frutas de la selva como aguaje, coco, camu-camu entre otros. También vende bebidas gasificadas como cervezas de marcas diferentes y gaseosas de distintos sabores. Realiza esta actividad en un local en el interior de la vivienda de su mamá. Se inició en esta actividad por la falta de ingresos económicos para poder  ayudar a sus hijos en los gastos de sus estudios. Su mamá le ayuda en las compras de las bebidas gasificas y sus hijos en la preparación de los helados. Comenta que su negocio es rentable por el intenso calor que hay en la ciudad, esto hace que sus clientes cada día aumenten y en consecuencia sus ventas se incrementan. Antes de iniciar esta actividad tuvo problemas económicos por que no podía solventar el gasto de los estudios de todos sus hijos, esto le causaba mucha preocupación. Pero su familia decidió apoyarla  económicamente para que  pusiera un pequeño negocio. Espera seguir manteniendo su negocio porque le brinda  buenas ganancias económicas y puede solventar sus gastos necesarios. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, se siente muy agradecida con la institución por darle la oportunidad de pertenecer aun grupo donde se apoyan mutuamente. Esto le motiva seguir siendo puntual en sus cuotas a pagar.
Con el monto solicitado  de 500 soles comprará frutas como aguaje, camu-camu, coco, etc. para hacer más helados y también adquirirá bebidas gasificadas al por mayor, para poder incrementar sus ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Reyna is 42 years old and is a kind and enterprising woman. She lives in her mother’s house with her three children aged 23, 20, and 15, who are all studying to have a better future. Reyna makes and sells fruit ice creams using fruits like aguaje, coconut, and camu camu among others. She also sells different flavored sodas and different types of beer. She runs her business from a part of her mother’s house. She started this business because she did not have enough income to be able to cover her children’s study expenses. Her mother helps her to buy the drinks, and her children help her to make the ice creams.

She comments that her business is profitable due to the fact that her city is very hot, meaning that every day she gets more and more customers and her sales increase. Before she started her business, she had money problems because she could not afford to pay for her children’s studies, and this worried her a lot. But her family decided to support her financially so that she could start a small business. She hopes to keep the business going because it makes good profits and allows her to cover her expenses.

This will be her third loan from MFP, and she is very grateful to the institution for giving her the opportunity to be a part of such a supportive group. This motivates her to continue making her repayments on time.

With the requested amount of 500 soles, she will buy fruits like aguaje, camu camu, coconut etc. to make more ice creams, and she will also buy sodas at wholesale so that she can increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fruits like aguaje, camu camu and coconut, and sodas for her ice cream business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell before the Christmas season

loans.name: Mzevinar

texts.en:
Mzevinar is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 children in Batumi, West Georgia. Mzevinar is a cleaner and her daughter is a waitress in hotel; they both get monthly income. Mzevinar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of her low income and family’s poor living conditions. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Because of her failure to get a traditional loan, Mzevinar requested a loan from Credo to start-up her family business. Her loan request was approved due to a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. These borrowers do not have access to credit products, for they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her loan, Mzevinar will renovate a flat, which she has bought to rent out. Because of tourism development in Batumi, Mzevinar believes that renovating this flat will help her earn income. This new business initiative, financed with a start-up loan from Kiva, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to renovate a flat to rent.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a 26-year-old youth client who is single and lives with five family members, two of whom are employed. He is from Iraq. Since 2011, Amjad has owned a small grocery store where he sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He has one employee. Amjad has developed a lot of good experience in his field and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Amjad is requesting a 1,200 USD youth loan to design a new display window and to increase his inventory. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and increase his profits to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to design a new display window and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Denis has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, posho, flour, and other items. 

To help expand his business, Denis has requested a loan of 3000000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. He will use this loan to increase his inventory of sugar, all types of flour and salt. This increased inventory will help Denis generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. Denis hopes that in the future he will be able to start a mini-supermarket. 

Denis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Denis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of sugar, all types of flour and salt.

loans.name: St Mary United Kitsutsu Gp Group

texts.en: Matia is a 43-year-old, married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the charcoal and firewood business for six years and also does farming as an additional income source. He says that if he had enough capital, he would deal in solar and bio gas since his current business is affecting the environment. He only does it to support his big family. Like most good fathers, he has dreams of educating his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification. Matia intends to use the loan facility to buy charcoal and firewood to sell. He is a member of the above-mentioned group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
Don Patricio es un joven artesano ibarreño que vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos él se definen como una persona triunfadora, humilde, Patricio comenta que con fe y trabajo todo le va a salir muy bien y construirá el camino para lograr sus metas.

El crédito que el Sr. Patricio solicito a Fodemi se lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como hierro, ángulos de metal, varilla y acero para la fabricación de cocinas industriales ya que su trabajo está siendo muy reconocido en su ciudad y cada vez es más solicitado.

El sueño que Don Patricio tiene es tener un gran taller de mecánica industrial donde pueda fabricar todo tipo de artefactos en metal, y generar empleo para los jóvenes que quieran aprender esta profesión.
texts.en:
Patricio is a young artisan from Ibarra who lives with his wife and his two children. He defines himself as a successful and unassuming person. Patricio belives that with faith and hard work, everything will go very well and he'll pave the way towards accomplishing his goals.
The loan that Patricio has requested from Fodemi will be used to purchase supplies such as iron, metal brackets, a welding rod and steel. He'll use them to make industrial kitchens, since his work is becoming very well-known in his town and it's in increasingly high demand.
Patricio's dream is to own a large industrial machine shop where he can manufacture all kinds of metal artifacts and create jobs for young people who wish to learn this trade.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as iron, metal brackets, a welding rod and steel for making industrial kitchens.

loans.name: Rodrigo José

texts.es: Rodrigo de 27 años de edad,  tiene un negocio de café internet en su natal San Jacinto. Allí adicionalmente vende mercancías variadas y también ofrece servicios de formación en manejo de aplicaciones de internet, hardware –software,  y refuerzo a estudiantes que complementan su buen rendimiento en clases.  Su idea de negocio surgió como alternativa de generar  ingresos, para aprovechar sus conocimientos y ponerlos al servicio de la comunidad. Los principales compradores de su oferta son estudiantes,  jóvenes y amas de casa. Su meta es organizar cada vez más su negocio y ampliar su cobertura de clientes, por eso se esmera trabajando persistentemente para cumplir su sueño. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará un servidor de internet  y mercancía variada, para responder a pedidos de su clientela, aprovechando la navidad y el año nuevo, época en la cual la demanda aumenta y Rodrigo inteligentemente, dirigirá su oferta hacia lo que mas vende en ella, haciendo que su credikiva tenga mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is 27, has an Internet café in his native city of San Jacinto, and also sells a variety of merchandise. He offers classes in Internet applications, hardware, and software and supports students who successfully complete the training. This business idea was an alternative way to earn income and to benefit from his knowledge and use it to serve his community. His first customers were students, teenagers, and homemakers. His goal is to better organize his business and increase his customer base, and he works very hard to achieve this dream. 

He is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy an Internet server and a variety of merchandise to meet his customers' orders. Rodrigo wants to make his Kiva loan a success by taking advantage of the high demand and offering desirable merchandise during the Christmas and New Year's season.

loans.use: to buy an Internet server and a variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is 48 years old and married to his wife, Liana. They live in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Liana works as a cleaner in a shop to earn a monthly income and Zakaria is currently unemployed. The family lives in poverty. According to Credo estimates, they belong to the vulnerable poor category. Zakaria decided to start a new business as their existing income isn’t enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. 

Zakaria is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to many credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Zakaria will use his loan to purchase a car and start a local taxi service. He hopes his loan will increase his family's income and enable them to improve their living conditions. Zakaria's family will also have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a local taxi service

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is married with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. Robinah works hard to manage her shop where she sells soft drinks and mik. 

Robinah is reqeusting a 2,500,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to increase her stock and buy more goods such as salt and milk to sell. Her loan will help to generate greater profits which will allow her to improve her living standard and buy basic necessities. In the future, Robinah hopes to start up a dairy. 

Robinah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robinah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase her stock and buy goods such as salt and milk to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 24 years old, single and lives with four family members, of whom two are employed.

Mohammad owns a car spare parts shop. He has been in this field since 2007. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their demands. He is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a 2,400 USD youth loan to pay the annual rent of the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of the shop

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 62 years old. He lives in Senaki District with his wife and 9-year-old son who goes to the local school. Tamaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for agricultural business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the monthly salary of Tamaz working locally as an artisan. The monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. It is hardly enough to feed a three-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category.

Tamaz requested a loan from Credo to start up a dairy farm. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Tamaz will purchase a milk cow. He will place it in an old empty farm building located in their yard. Tamaz will work hard on the farm. He will produce cheese and sell it in the village. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer  is 49 years old and is married with six children, two of whom are currently in school. She lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past eight years, Jennifer has been working hard to manage her boutique where she sells men's and children's clothing. 

Jennifer is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothes to stock her shop. Her loan will help to generate greater profits, boost her business, and increase her family's income. In the future, Jennifer hopes that she will be able to live a good life that is free from poverty. 

Jennifer is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jennifer who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy clothing to stock her shop

loans.name: Meslem

texts.en:
Meslem, 22, is from Iraq. He is a youth client. Single, he lives with two family members. He is the only provider in the family.

Meslem owns small cafeteria. He established his business in 2011, and now he has one employee. He has earned good experience in this field, and he has an excellent reputation in the surrounding area.

He is requesting a $2,400 youth loan to renovate his cafeteria and install new ceramics on the cafeteria’s floor and walls. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he can provide his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate his cafeteria and install new ceramic tiles on the cafeteria’s floor and walls

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 29 years old and is single with two children, one of whom is currently in school. She lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past five years, Harriet  has been working hard to manage her boutique where she sells clothing. 

Harriet is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothes to increase her stock. Her loan will help to generate greater profits and increase her family's income level. In the future,  Harriet hopes that she will be able to live a good life. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Neyl De Jesus

texts.es: Neyl  de 42 años de edad vive en el municipio de San Jacinto, donde se dedica ala venta de café y sus derivados en un kiosco que tiene desde al año 2011, aunque su experiencia data de 11 años, cuando trabajó en esta misma tarea; aprovechando su experiencia de capacitación, realizada en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje - SENA,  organizó su iniciativa de negocios,  vendiendo café, malteadas, granizados de café molido  y diversos productos a base de café. En la actualidad su clientela ha crecido y requiere una mayor infraestructura, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará un molino de café dos mesas, sillas y necesita reacondicionar su kiosco. Él está muy satisfecho, pues todos los procesos lo hacen directamente y con café orgánico, que muelen ellos mismos, pues es apoyado por su esposa también. Sus compras las realiza directamente a los agricultores ubicados en los Montes de Maria, área de su convergencia y sus ventas las realiza directamente al consumidor, apuntándole a su gran sueño futuro, de  tener un punto de venta en México y también uno en Nueva York, pero su gran desafío, es crecer lo suficiente porque los recursos financieros puede lograrlos poco a poco y en eso está trabajando gradualmente.
texts.en:
Neyl is 42 years old and lives in the municipality of San Jacinto where he makes a living selling coffee and coffee products in a kiosk that he has had since 2011. However, he has 11 years of experience in this work when he worked in SENA--National Learning Service, and was able to take advantage of the education provided. He organized business initiatives, selling coffee, milk shakes, iced coffee, and other products derived from coffee. 

His clientele has now grown and he needs a greater infrastructure, which is why he now needs a Kiva loan, his first loan that he is taking out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan he will buy a coffee grinder, two tables, chairs and will pay for the repairs needed for his kiosk. He is very satisfied because he manages his business directly and uses organic coffee that he grinds himself and with the support of his wife. He buys directly from farmers located in Montes de María and he sells directly to the consumer. He has a dream to have a kiosk in Mexico and in New York in the future. However, his greatest challenge is to grow enough because he can only obtain the resources little by little. He is working gradually to accomplish this.

loans.use: to buy a coffee grinder, two tables, chairs and to repair his kiosk.

loans.name: La Cascada Ii Group

texts.es: Christopher es parte del grupo La Cascada II, desde hace 4 años trabaja con la financiera y dice que le ha ayudado mucho en su negocio del transporte por lo que está muy orgullosos de pertenecer a VisionFund. El tiene 34 años y está casado con Brenda quien es maestra en un bachillerato, ellos tienen dos niños pequeños el mayor va a clases de preescolar y un niño de 7 meses, el es originario de una comunidad llamada San Felipe de los Alzati un lugar lleno en riqueza natural donde año con año cultivan flor para la temporada decembrina llamada Nochebuena, también es conocido por ser un lugar turístico ya muy cerca se encuentran la zona arqueológica de Zirahuato y el Santuario de la Mariposa Monarca. Dice que él estudio varias carreras técnicas como electrónica, computación, carpintería y corte y confección, pero en ninguna de estas trabaja, dice que desde muy jovencito ayudo a su mamá con los gastos del hogar ya que ella es viuda y le tocó ser responsable de su familia desde muy chico. Dice que con mucho esfuerzo entre él y su mamá compraron una combi con la cual él trabaja desde hace mas de 13 años y dice que su ruta empieza en la población de Zitácuaro y pasa por diferentes comunidades hasta llegar a la localidad llamada Dongu; también tiene otras 2 rutas. Ahorita él está pidiendo un crédito para darle mantenimiento a su combi y a otras dos mas que tiene porque quiere comprarles varias piezas que están fallando y llantas que es en lo que más gasta. Comenta que el préstamo le beneficiara demasiado ya que mandará reparar sus combis de servicio público, por que el de ahí mantiene a su familia y sus hermanos tienen un trabajo estable ya que ellos le ayudan a trabajar las otras dos combis. La meta que tiene para su negocio del transporte público es tratar de ahorrar dinero para comprar un vehículo nuevo para meterlo a trabajar como trasporte público y mejorar las unidades que ya tiene. Las otras cuatro integrantes del grupo se llaman Tomasa, Irma, Estela G. y Estela M. ellas invertirán sus créditos en la compra de insumos para surtir tienda de abarrotes, en la compra de colches, perfumes, cosméticos por catalogo para vender, surtirá frutas y legumbres de temporada para su venta.
texts.en:
Christopher has been a member of the communal bank La Cascada II for four years. He is proud to belong to Vision Fund because it has helped his transport business very much. He is 34 and married to Brenda, who is a high school teacher. They have two small children: one is in preschool, and the other is seven months old. Christopher was born in San Felipe de los Alzati, a beautiful place where a winter season flower called Nochebuena is grown every year. It is also a tourist destination close to the Zirahuato and Santuario de la Mariposa Monarca archeological sites. 

He has taken classes in electronics, computer technology, carpentry, and cutting and sewing, but none in his current profession. As a youngster, he helped his mother meet the household expenses, since she was a widow and he was responsible for his family from an early age. With their combined efforts, they bought a van that he has used to offer public transport service for 13 years. His route begins in Zitácuaro and passes through different towns until it ends in Dongu; he has two other routes as well. 

He is applying for a loan to do maintenance on the three vans and also to buy spare parts and tires. This loan will let him repair his transport vans and will be of great help in supporting his family and his brothers, who have regular work driving two of the vans. His goal for the business is to save money to buy a new transport van and increase his profits.

The four other group members are Tomasa, Irma, Estela G., and Estela M. They will use their loans to buy merchandise for a grocery store; to buy catalog perfumes and cosmetics for resale; and to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to maintain his transport vans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more second-hand clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Abdon

texts.es:
Abdón radica en la localidad de Santa Rosa, a sus 37 años comparte una vida conyugal con Ruth de 33 años, juntos lograron a través de esfuerzo y trabajo forjarles una buena educación a sus 4 hijos con valores y principios. Posee una vivienda construida  a base de madera. Se desempeña como agricultor de cacao orgánico desde muy niño debido a que sus padres y abuelos fueron fieles productores de diversos productos agrícolas. Lleva 30 años como productor independiente gracias a unas parcelas que adquirió hace mucho tiempo por los propietarios que remataron el lugar.
Se siente muy orgullo de ser un gran productor de la zona, pues gracias al permanente apoyo de Ruth en diversas actividades han logrado en muchas ocasiones evitar la contratación de jornaleros para las diversas tareas, pues con la basta experiencia en el campo tienen una gran habilidad en tareas agrícolas para el sembrado, deshierbo y deschuponado de los árboles cacaoteros obteniendo así buenas ganancias y haciendo de este un gran trabajo en equipo que los reconforta como pareja.
Como parte de un plan para el reemplazo de árboles de cacao desfasados, desea introducir a sus parcelas injertos de cacao para sacarle el máximo provecho posible a sus plantaciones, para ello requiere contar con capital urgente para la compra de plantas de almácigo, abono orgánico consistente en guano de isla de preferencia y la adquisición de herramientas para facilitar el arduo trabajo venidero.
Por lo general las plantaciones de cacao requieren algún tipo de sombra cuando se encuentran en crecimiento inicial , es por ello que se encuentra realizando el sembrado de árboles madereros para sombra permanente que a futuro espera comercializarlos como bloques de madera ya que considera es un buen negocio al que le gustaría ingresar.  Ahora solicita 1,000 mil soles para comprar almácigos y usarlos como injertos de cacao, asimismo comprará abono orgánico, muy esencial para una producción de calidad.
texts.en:
Abdón lives in the Santa Rosa community.  At thirty-seven years old, he shares his life with his partner Ruth, who is thirty-three years old.  Together, with their effort and work pushing them forward, they have provided a good education with values and morals to their four children.  He has a home constructed of wood.  

He has worked as an organic cacao farmer since he was a young boy, since his parents and grandparents were also faithful producers of various crops.  He has been an independent producer for thirty years, thanks to some land he acquired from owners who auctioned it off.

He feels very proud to be a great producer in this area.  Thanks to the permanent support of Ruth in their different activities, they have managed to avoid hiring day laborers for various tasks.  With all of their experience in the countryside, they are very capable in farming tasks, like planting, weeding, and pruning the cacao trees.  They obtain good profits and make a great team effort that revitalizes them as a couple.

As part of a plan to replace the old cacao trees, he wishes to bring in plot grafts to take the maximum advantage possible from their crops.  This requires him to count on urgent capital to buy seedling trays, an organic fertilizer made of sea bird dung from the Peruvian Islands, and to purchase the tools needed for the hard work ahead.

In general, the cacao plantations require a type of shade when they initially begin to grow.  For this reason, he finds himself planting timber trees for shade.  In the future, he hopes to sell them as blocks of wood.  He already thinks this is a good business that he would like to get into.  

He is requesting 1000 "soles" to buy seedling trays to use in grafting process for the cacao plants.  He will also buy organic fertilizer, which is very essential for a quality yield.

loans.use: to buy seedling trays to use in the grafting process for cacao plants, and to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, 50, lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 19 years, Mildred  has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells breakfast, lunch and supper. 

To help expand her business, Mildred has requested a loan of 2500000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve to improve her kitchen and stock food to cook and resell. This will help Mildred to generate greater profits, boosting the business and increasing her family's income. Mildred  hopes that in the future she will be able to be self-reliant and productive. 

Mildred  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mildred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to improve her kitchen and stock food to cook and resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: María Lourdes tiene 42 años y es originaria de la población de Zitácuaro, ella ha trabajo con VisionFund desde hace cuatro años aunque antes formaba parte de un grupo llamado Barandillas, pero decidió salirse y pedir un crédito individual con el cual está muy emocionada ya que tiene fe en que su negocio crecerá a través del nuevo crédito. Desde hace mas de 21 años tiene un taller de alta costura en su casa, dice que todo empezó por que en la escuela secundaria iba en el taller de corte y confección y que cuando salió de la preparatoria le llamaba la atención el crear ropa así que decidió inscribirse en una escuela particular para perfeccionar sus técnicas de elaboración de prendas, dice que ella hace blusas, trajes sastres, pantalones, faldas, pants, sabanas, cobertores, pijamas etc. y que en temporada en que los niños y jóvenes entran a clases, va a las escuelas a vender los uniformes y a veces la misma escuela le pide elaborar los uniformes tanto de diario como los de gala. También hace trajes para bailables, disfraces, vestidos de quince años, vestidos de novia, vestidos de noche. Dice que el crédito que está pidiendo es para comprar material como telas de diferentes texturas y colores, hilos, sierres, botones, agujas, y muchas otras cosas más que ocupa para hacer sus confecciones. Ella está muy contenta porque dice que gracias a su nuevo crédito mejorara muchísimo su negocio aparte de que quiere comprar varias telas y material porque quiere hacer juegos de baño, juegos para salas y comedores como manteles de época navideña ya que eso se le vende a un buen precio. Comenta que irá a la Ciudad de México y de Toluca donde comprara su material ya que uno de sus hermanos la llevará para hacer los pedidos que después llevan hasta su casa ya que ella comprara por mayoreo. Ella es madre soltera de una niña y dice que le está echando muchas ganas para salir adelante porque quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y así ahorrar para sus estudios cuando este grande. Dice que su carta de recomendación es la propia gente que la recomienda con más personas ya que trabaja muy bonito y delicadamente.
texts.en:
María Lourdes is 42 years old and originally from the town of Zitácuaro. She has worked with VisionFund for four years although before she was part of a group called Barandillas. She decided to leave and ask for an individual loan with which she is very excited since she has faith in that her business will grow because of the new loan. For more than 21 years, she has had a couture shop in her home. She says that it all began because in high school she would go to the cutting and sewing workshop, and when she left high school creating clothing caught her attention. Therefore, she decided to enroll in a special school to perfect her techniques for the production of clothing. She says that she makes blouses, suits, pants, skirts, trousers, sheets, bedspreads, pajamas, etc. In the season in which the children and youths begin school, she goes to the schools to sell uniforms, and sometimes that same school will ask her to make daily and full-dress uniforms. Also, she makes suits for dances, costumes, fifteenth-birthday dresses, wedding dresses, and evening gowns.

She says that the loan that she is requesting is to buy material like cloth of different textures and colors, thread, zippers, buttons, needles, and many more things needed to make her clothing. She is very happy because she says that thanks to her new loan her business will improve a lot. Apart from this, she wants to buy a variety of cloths and materials because she wants to make bathroom, living room, and dining room sets, like Christmas table cloths since these are sold at a good price.

She comments that she will go to Mexico City and de Toluca where she will buy her material since one of her siblings will take her there to place the orders that afterwards they will bring to her house since she will buy wholesale. 

She is the single mother of one daughter, and she says that she is making her want very much to come out ahead because she wants to improve her quality of life and to save money for her studies when she is older. She says that her recommendation letter is from the same people who recommend her to others since her products are very pretty and delicately made.

loans.use: to buy material such as cloth of different textures and colors, thread, zippers, buttons, needles, and many more things needed to make her clothing.

loans.name: Othman

texts.en:
Othman is a 45-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and five children. Othman owns a small farm of olive trees which gives the family a seasonal income. He also drives a taxi. These two sources of income do not bring in enough money for the family's needs. One of Othman's sons is at university studying business administration.

Othman took out a loan from FATEN to pay his son's university fees. This loan helps the family by paying the studying expenses and ensuring Othman's son's bright future. 

Othman appears in the picture next to his taxi.

loans.use: to pay his son's university fees.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael is a 26 years old, married, works as a teacher in the public sector and supplements his low income by raising cattle. His livestock help him and his wife pay for necessities. He previously took out a youth loan from FATEN to buy additional cows and expand his farm, and successfully completed both projects. He is requesting a new loan to buy more cows. His goal is to raise his income and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man. He is a worker who has a small income. This income is not enough to cover his needs. Mohammad wants to finish building his house. He needs to buy more constructions supplies like cement, wood and other supplies. This loan will help Mohammad buy all the supplies he needs to complete his house. Mohammad requests a USD youth loan from FATEN to purchase all the constructions supplies. Mohammad is photographed in the location of his house.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to complete building his home

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married  and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past four years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her retail shop, selling salt, sugar and other items. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock like sugar, cooking oil, and soap to be re-sold; it will help Joyce generate greater profits, increase the store's stock, and help the business to grow. Joyce hopes that in the future she will be able to have a big business. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock like sugar, cooking oil, and soap to be re-sold.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Annet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, rice and flour. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy and stock goods such as sugar, salt and soap for resell, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Annet hopes that in the future, she will be able to have a big business. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy and stock goods such as sugar, salt and soap for resell.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is 40 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two currently in school. For the past five years, Enid has been working hard to manage her business,  which sells soft drinks and alcohol. 

To help expand her business, Enid has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a refrigerator and more soft drinks to sell, and will help Enid generate greater profits to improve her standard of living. Enid hopes that in the future, she will be able to be a good entrepreneur. 

Enid is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Enid who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en: Ariunaa is 42 years old lives with her mother and two children in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her mother is a little bit sick and stays home. Her son Semjaan, 19, is a university student and her daughter Semjid,16, attends secondary school. She has been operating a business selling clothing supplies for years and stopped her business because she started working in a private company. Now, she is restarting her clothing supplies business in the local market. It will be easier this time because she has years of experience. She is having problems with cash and is now requesting 1'500'000 MNT to pay her son's university tuition fee and accommodations in the capital city. She is a hardworking and friendly person.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition fee and accommodations in the capital city.

loans.name: Twesiga Mukama Group

texts.en:
In the previous loan, one member of the group, Alex, was able to buy food items for her food stall. She also paid school fees for her children, who have now got holidays. She re-sold the food items and gained some profit. She is now getting 800,000ugx to buy coffee from the village at a cheaper price. She brings it to town to sell at a higher price to supplement her already constrained income. She is confident that with the partnership of Ugafode, her goals will soon be achieved.

Now Rose, Alex's neighbor at the business premise, has been attracted to the group because of the change that occurred to Alex's business, and family.

Having seen Alex's business expand, and the influx of customers because of the better services she now offers, Rose was convinced the group had done a great change for Alex, and Rose decided to join. She will use the 300,000 ugx to buy better utencils for her restaurant so she can attract more customers. 

Her major challenge has been limited capital. Rose is shrewd and honest.  She lives in a poorly structured house and hopes, that if lenders finance her, she could build a better house in the future.

loans.use: To buy utencils for the restaurant.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is 55 years old. She lives in the Kutaisi District with her husband, son, daughter, daughter-in-law and an infant granddaughter. Nanuli requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural business start-up, without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time due to low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the monthly salary of Nanuli’s husband, working as a local artisan. The family has pigs, and sells piglets seasonally.

The monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. It is hardly enough to feed a six-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs in the vulnerable poor category.
 
Nanuli requested a loan from Credo to start up a dairy farm. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides for a business start-up, and re-startups.  It has credits for soft conditions for the country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Nanuli will purchase a milk cow. She will place it in an old empty farm building located in their yard. Nanuli will work hard on the farm. She will produce cheese, and sell it in the village. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow to start up her new business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 32 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, one currently in school. For the past four years, Christine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, rice and flour. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 12,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy soft drinks, rice and bedding, and will help Christine to generate greater profits to improve her way of living. Christine hopes that in the future, she will be able to be a good entrepreneur. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice and bedding.

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah is 43 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past seven years, Aminah has been working hard to manage her kiosk, which sells raw matooke (Ugandan bananas). 

To help expand her business, Aminah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more matooke, and will help Aminah to generate greater profits to improve her way of living. Aminah hopes that in the future, she will be able to be a good entrepreneur.. 

Aminah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aminah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more matooke (Ugandan bananas).

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is 36 years old and lives in the Khobi District with her husband and 3-year-old son.  Maka requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times for an agricultural start-up without success.  Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.  The only source of income for the family is the agricultural business, which is a plot of land where maize, laurel leaves, and citrus are grown.  In addition, the family runs a small dairy farm of 3 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products.  The monthly income of the family is hardly enough to feed three people.  

According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category.  Maka requested a loan from Credo to start a dairy farm.  Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit due to low income (which labels them as “high risk borrowers”).
With the requested loan, Maka will purchase a car which will be used to take the cheese to nearby villages for sale.  This will significantly decrease their transportation costs and allow additional savings for home renovation.  Maka awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car to transport cheese.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 29 years old and married to a businessman. She earns a living by selling beer in a store that she has been running for three years. She is requesting a loan to buy more beer to sell, and will use the profits made possible by this loan to set aside money as savings.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nutty

texts.en:
Nutty is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 20 years, Nutty has been working hard to manage his leather business, which sells shoes. 

To help expand his business, Nutty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more good leather shoes to sell. By increasing his inventory, Nutty will be able to generate greater profits and expand his business by buying more goods. Nutty hopes that in the future he will be able to to produce quality goods. 

Nutty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nutty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more good leather shoes to be sold

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is married with three children aged between one month and five years old. She sells animals. With this loan, she will buy more goats and hens to sell. She will use the profits from her business to buy a cow so that she can provide milk for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goats and hens to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise is 26 and she has two children. She sells wood and has been in the business for the past 4 years.

With this loan, she would like to buy more wood for resale. She will use the profit from the business to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more timbers for resale.

loans.name: Osee

texts.en: Osee is married to a businesswoman and they have eight children. Osee is 52 years old. He owns a pharmacy and has been running the business for the past 10 years. With this loan, he wants to buy more medicine to sell in the pharmacy. The profits will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more medicine to sell in his pharmacy.

loans.name: St.augustine Good Samaritan Group

texts.en: Mary is a 42 year old woman who deals in poultry farming; she began this business because she wanted to raise money to pay school fees for her children. She has 5 children and all of them go to school. Her main challenges include price fluctuations, high prices of the poultry feed and high competition at her village. She would like to improve the quality of her poultry in the future to boost her business and improve the standards of living of her family. She is a very hard working woman.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Jacqueline Enith

texts.es: Jacqueline  compró materiales para elaborar bolsos en su taller de confección, así mismo pudo comprar una máquina nueva con la que aumentó su proceso productivo y brindó a su clientela una mejor calidad en sus productos. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva con el cual comprará hilo fino, con los cuales elaborárá muchos bolsos demandados en otras regiones del país. Su credikiva tendrá éxito,, pues está soportado en pedidos de su clientela a la que poco a poco se da a conocer y la mantiene conytenta y dispuesta a hacerle solicitudes permanetemente. El dice a sus financiadores muchas gracias y pide que continuen apoyandola para continuar trabajando con sus recursos.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is buying materials to make bags in her dressmaking shop, and also, she wants to buy a new sewing machine in order to augment her productive process and offer her clientele a better quality of products.  

At present, Jacqueline is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can purchase fine thread to make the many bags demanded in other regions of the country. Her Kiva loan will produce success, as evidenced by the customer requests that are, little by little, materializing. Jacqueline is encouraged and she is disposed to turn these into permanent orders.

Jacqueline wishes to say 'many thanks' to her financial supporters and she asks for their ongoing assistance so that she can continue working with these resources.

loans.use: to buy fine thread in larger volumn for making bags.

loans.name: Satou

texts.fr: Satou est une veuve âgée de 49 ans, mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 18 et 30 ans et parmi lesquels un seul va encore à l'école. elle a une autre personne en plus à sa charge. elle mène une activité de vente de tissus pagnes, des bijoux et des parfums à domicile depuis 11 ans. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des tissus, des bijoux, des sacs et des parfums pour renforcer son stock de marchandise afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille devenus trop lourd le décès de son époux. elle a pour ambition d'ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
Satou is 49 years old, and a widow. She has three children aged between 18 and 30, only one of whom is still in school. Satou has one other dependant. 

For 11 years, Satou has run a business selling traditional cloth pagnes, jewellery and perfumes from home. She has good experience in this area. 

Satou would like to use this loan to purchase cloth, jewellery, bags and perfumes to boost her stock so that she can meet her customers' needs. The income generated from this will help her to better meet the needs of her family, which have been a heavy burden since the loss of her husband. Her ambition is to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy goods.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is 43 years old. She owns a boutique that she has been running for the past 5 years. 

With this loan, she wants to add more merchandise to the boutique. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell in her boutique.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.en: José Francisco, a dairy farmer in Mexico State, processes much of his milk into cheese and yogurt because he can sell them at higher and more stable prices than milk. However, production is energy intensive and requires multiple tanks of non-renewable and expensive LP gas per month. That is why he is requesting a loan to buy a 16-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester that will convert the abundant cow manure on his farm into renewable fuel, and give him a cleaner, more environmentally-friendly and cheaper energy source. The system will also generate hundreds of liters of fertilizer per day for use on the maize and alfalfa he uses as animal feed. This loan represents almost half of the total cost of the Sistema Biobolsa biodigester he plans to buy.

loans.use: to buy a biodigester, which converts animal waste into fuel.

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en:
Annonciata is 35, and she is married with five children. She sells sodas and beers. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to get the loan to buy more sodas. She will use the profits from her business to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more sodas to sell in her bar.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 33 years old. He sells clothes and has been selling clothes for the past 8 years. 

He would like to get the loan to add more clothes for resale. Paul will use the profits from the business to make savings and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ana Cenobia

texts.es: Ana tiene un negocio de confecciones y está muy agradecida por el credikiva anterior pues le dieron la oportunidad de participar en el programa de Kiva en la Fundación y pudo aumentar el volumen de sus compras en telas bordados, enseres de confección. Su negocio ahora ha mejorado y ha logrado producir mucho mas aumentando sus ingresos. Su meta mas adelante es tener empleados, ampliando su proceso productivo y con ello la infraestructura de su clientela.  En la actualidad se prepara para recibir las navidades y el año nuevo, con un significativo número de pedidos de servicios de costura de vestidos y por eso acude nuevamente a Kiva, pues con su credito comprará materias primas e insumos, para hacer vestidos elegantes que responderán a la demanda de su mercado y aquí radica el éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en: Ana has a sewing business and is very grateful for her previous Kiva loan because she got the opportunity of participating in the Kiva program in the Fundación and was able to increase the volume of her purchases of fabric, embroidery and sewing supplies.  Her business has now improved and she’s managed to produce much more thus increasing her income.  Her goal for later on is to hire employees and expand her productive process and with it the infrastructure of her customer base.  She’s currently preparing to receive Christmas and New Year’s with a significant increase in dressmaking orders and this is why she’s calling on Kiva once again because she’ll use her loan to buy more raw materials and supplies to make elegant gowns to respond to market demand because that’s what her loan’s success is based on.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en:
Anastasie is 37 years old. She owns a bar and has been running the bar for the past 5 years.

With the loan, she would like to add more beer for resale. She will use the profits from the business to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more beer for resale.

loans.name: Bhawani

texts.en:
Bhawani is 48 years old, married and two children.  In 2000, she established  her milk selling business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she suppoorts her family.  

Bhawani is requesting her fifth loan from Patan BPW, which she will use to buy a young milk-producing cow.  In the future, Bhawani plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to purchase a young milk.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es: Luis de 50 años de edad, vive en la hermosa capital de Colombia: Bogotá; él desde muy temprano empieza su proceso de fabricación de artesanías en fique, que consiste las operaciones de lavar, tinturar, desmenuzar, coser y comercializar su principal producto, “los individuales de mesa” en diferentes diseños. Luis realiza sus compras en centros artesanales, donde venden los insumos para que él logre los mejores acabados de piezas y sus ventas las realiza con una frecuencia diaria y de contado. Su experiencia de 30 años, es muy reconocida y por eso los almacenes de artesanías lo prefieren. Su meta es duplicar la producción actual pues tiene pedidos y requiere hacer compras de sus materias primas en mayor cantidad; esto es justamente lo que lo mueve a hacer un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará fique, lana, hilos, cabuyas, trenzas en junco, bolsas plásticas etc. Con su credikiva pondrá en práctica su particular fuerza comercial, pues es un desafío “lograr una gran agresividad en su mercado” como el mismo lo dice.
texts.en: Luis, 50, lives in the beautiful capital of Colombia: Bogotá.  He starts his fique [fiber made from agave leaves] crafts-making process very early.  It consists in washing, dying, sifting, sewing and selling his main product: place mats in various designs.  Luis makes his purchases in crafts centers where supplies are sold that make it possible for him to reach the best results with his pieces and his sales are daily and are cash.  His 30 years’ experience is very well-known and this is why crafts stores prefer him.  His goal is to double his current production because he has orders pending and needs to buy raw materials in larger amounts which is precisely what motivates him to seek a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to buy fique, wool, thread, sisal rope, reeds, plastic bags, etc.  With his Kiva loan he will put into practice his particular commercial strength because it’s a challenge “to attain great market drive,” as he, himself says.
