Juan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, entre otros para poder mejorar su cultivo y tener una buena cosecha, con lo cual seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa de material noble ya que actualmente es de adobe y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Juan, 52, lives in the city of Chincha that’s noted for its warm, welcoming climate as well as for the cheerfulness of its inhabitants.  Juan’s a very hardworking man above all because he’s the father of two marvelous children and together with his wife they focus all their efforts into giving their family a life with dignity.  

Juan works day to day in agriculture, especially growing cotton.  He’s been doing this for 15 years and spends about nine hours daily at work.  He’s always watchful of his crops and this is why he believes he does well in his business, because of his dedication to it and his desire to get ahead.

Juan is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he’ll be able to buy manure and fertilizer, among others, to improve his crops and have a good harvest; he will continue striving towards making his greatest dream reality: to build his house out of substantial materials because it’s currently adobe and to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer, among others.

loans.name: Clavel Group

texts.es: Julissa tiene 29 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Clavel, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, son una familia muy luchadora y responsable. Ella inicio su negocio vendiendo golosinas y jugos, luego decidió vender comida y el negocio le resulto por lo que en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de carne asada y golosinas, su horario de atención es de 4:00 pm a 10:00 pm. El préstamo que solicita Julissa lo invertirá en la compra de productos como ser: carnes, frijoles, manteca, vegetales, queso, que es para elaborar la comida que ofrece a sus clientes. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá ofrecer más producto a su clientela. El único inconveniente que se le presenta a Julissa es la competencia ya que hay un lugar cerca donde venden golosinas por lo que ella busca vender su producto de calidad para que no le afecte en sus ventas. Su meta es establecer un restaurante para atender mejor a sus clientes y ofrecer mas productos que satisfagan los deseos de su clientela. Es el primer financiamiento que Julissa solicita en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en: Julissa, 29, is a member of the “Clavel” (Carnation) communal bank; she’s married and her husband is a merchant.  They are a hardworking, responsible family.  She started her business selling snacks and juices and then decided to sell food and the business had good results so she still is selling grilled meat and snacks.  She’s open to the public from 4pm until 10pm.  The loan Julissa is requesting is to buy products like meat, beans, lard, vegetables and cheese to make the food she offers her customers.  With support from the loan she will be able to offer more products to her clientele.  The only inconvenience Julissa faces is competition since there’s another place nearby that sells snacks which is why she tries to sell top quality products so her sales won’t be affected.  Her goal is to open a restaurant to better care for her customers and offer more products that will satisfy their wishes.  This is Julissa’s first loan request to FAMA and she expects to make her installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy meat, cheese and beans, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doughnuts, cigarettes, rice, fish canes and other stock to resell.

loans.name: Lidia Susana

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer ecuatoriana joven de 35 años, se casó muy joven pero terminó sus estudios secundarios, actualmente está separada de su pareja y está dedicada a sacar sola adelante a sus 3 hijos que tienen 13, 9 y 6 años. Aunque la separación fue una prueba muy difícil tanto para sus hijos como para ella, juntos han formado una familia ejemplar. Viven en el barrio de Chimbacalle que está ubicado en el sector sur de la ciudad de Quito, capital de la República del Ecuador. Hasta hace pocos años el sector sur de la ciudad de Quito, no era tomado en cuenta dentro de los sectores económicos fuertes de la capital de la República del Ecuador, ahora este sector es considerado una fuerza de la economía de la ciudad. En este lugar se encuentran familias emprendedoras que han luchado para sobresalir. Entre nativos y migrantes de otras ciudades y países, ha sido el punto de encuentro de habitantes de varias provincias, y está reconstruido con extensas calles. Chimbacalle en donde reside Lidia, es un barrio con una alta actividad comercial que es cada vez más fortalecida y que aporta en gran manera al crecimiento económico de la ciudad. Se destaca en esta zona los parques con amplias zonas verdes en los cuales se dan cita las familias los fines de semana. Hay gran accesibilidad a todo tipo de servicios y sus habitantes son emprendedores que aprovechan cada oportunidad que se presenta con establecimiento de nuevos negocios. Ventas  ambulantes, niños trabajando, familias con necesidad son muchos de los cuadros que se visualiza en este sector. 
Lidia se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa casual desde hace 5 años, este emprendimiento fue muy importante para ella, pues sería el sustento para ella y sus hijos a partir de la separación, si bien es cierto, antes se dedicaba a estas ventas como un hobby para aportar con un ingreso adicional a su hogar, luego se convirtió en su trabajo a tiempo completo y ahora son esos ingresos los que proveen de educación y bienestar a sus hijos. En un inicio, solo vendía cosméticos pero sus clientes demandaban también ropa y ahora, cada día dedica desde 6 o más horas a recoger pedidos de sus clientes, a clasificar la ropa nueva que tiene, a entregar el pedido en la dirección de cada cliente, a cobrar las cuentas pendientes. Todo esto, sin descuidar la atención a sus hijos ayudándoles con las tareas, revisando y estudiando con ellos. Lidia solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mayores descuentos en su factura final, de esta forma su ganancia incrementará y así un día podrá cumplir su sueño de tener su propio almacén de ropa, el cual le sustentará para darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de conseguir un título profesional que les lleve muy alto. Lidia agradece que Fundación Alternativa le brindó confianza para obtener este crédito con el que además obtuvo asesoría para visionar y proyectar su negocio a futuro.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 35-year-old Ecuadorian woman. She married young, but she was able to finish high school. She’s currently separated and raising her children on her own – they’re 13, 9 and 6 years old. Although the separation was a difficult time for her children and herself, together they have since become an exemplar family. They live in the Chimbacalle neighborhood that’s located in the south of the city of Quito, which is the capital of the Republic of Ecuador. Up until the last few years, the southern part of Quito was not considered as playing a major part in the economy of the city, but now it’s considered one of the city’s economical strengths. In this area you’ll find determined families who have fought to get ahead. From natives to migrants from other cities and countries, this area has been the meeting point of people from various provinces and has been reconstructed with extensive streets. Chimbacalle, where Lidia resides, is a very commercial neighborhood that is constantly growing and lends itself to the economic growth of the city. There are parks with big green spaces where families meet on the weekends. There is access to a great number of services and the people in this area, with determination, use every opportunity that presents itself to establish new businesses. In this area, you will see street vendors, working children and families in need.
Lidia is a street vendor and she's been selling casual clothing for 5 years. This undertaking was very important for her, as it was the only livelihood she had for her herself and her children since the separation. Previous to the separation, she worked as a street vendor and brought in some extra money, but it was more of a hobby; afterwards it became her fulltime job and the income now provides the education and wellbeing of her children. In the beginning, she sold only cosmetics, but there was demand for clothing, so she now dedicates about 6 hours or more each day to taking down orders from her clients, classifying the new clothing she has, delivering the orders to each address and collecting outstanding accounts. All of that work, while still attending to her children; helping them with homework, going over lessons and studying.
Lidia is requesting a loan to buy wholesale merchandise in order to get more discounts on her final bill. This will help increase her earnings so that one day she can accomplish her dream: owning her own clothing store that will help sustain her family and provide her children the opportunity to earn professional degrees that will take them further in life. Lidia is grateful that Fundación Alternativa believed in her enough to provide her with a loan and the training needed to visualize and project her business into the future.

loans.use: buy wholesale clothing, cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Elizabeth Rosaura

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, tiene casa propia, sin embargo vive con su madre en el Sector La Campiña en Cayaltí, ubicado a 1 hora de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Elizabeth se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de de productos de belleza.  Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, los mismos que alimenta hasta que alcancen tamaño y peso ideal para su posterior venta.  Con los ingresos que recibe apoya en la manutención de su familia.

Elizabeth necesita comprar más productos de belleza para su posterior venta, además de comprar animales para engorde y posterior venta también.  Es por ello que para lograrlo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old, married and has three dependent children. She owns her home, nevertheless she is living with her mother in Sector La Campiña in Cayalti, located one hour from Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque.

Elizabeth has been selling beauty products for four years. She also raises and sells farmyard animals. She feeds them until they reach an ideal size and weight. She supports her family with her earnings.

Elizabeth needs to purchase more beauty products to sell and also more animals to fatten  for sale. Consequently she is requesting a loan of S/. 2,000 from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and animals for later re-sale.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene carga familiar directa.  Vive en casa propia, ubicada en el Caserio Sialupe Huamantanga perteneciente a Lambayeque.  Santos vive en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque,   cuenta con servicios de agua y luz , el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 50  familias.
  
La actividad que desarrolla Santos, es la crianza y comercialización  de animales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, el negocio está situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.   Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su desarrollo.  Cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto por actividades relacionadas  a la agricultura.

Santos desea comprar cerdos y pavos para comercializarlos en esta navidad y con esto incrementar sus ventas.  Es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Santos, 26, is single and has no direct dependents.  He lives in his own house located in Caserío Sialupe Huamantanga belonging to Lambayeque.  Santos lives in the rural part of Lambayeque District and has running water and electricity; the place is small community of about 50 families.

The activity Santos carries out is raising and selling animals.  He’s been in this business for ten years.  The business is located at home.  He learned it from his parents, that is to say, he knows it to perfection.  This business has competition but it also has a large market to develop in.  He earns extra income in activities related to agriculture.

Santos wants to buy pigs and turkeys to sell for Christmas and increase his sales this way which is why he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1,000 new sol loan to reach his objective.

loans.use: to buy pigs and turkeys to sell for Christmas.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es un padre de familia que tiene 46 años de edad, reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Caylatí, una zona de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada dentro de la provincia de Lambayeque a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Él cuenta desde hace 8 años con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de primera necesidad, entre abarrotes, verduras y demás perecibles. Su clientela prefiere su negocio ya que siempre brinda productos de calidad y un buen trato. El negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. 

Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral y se dedica a las labores agrícolas, recibiendo un pago como jornal.

Oscar desea adquirir más abarrotes para ampliar su negocio y satisfacer a la demanda con la que cuenta. Para ello ha creído coveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.  Asimismo comprará medicina para su madre que se encuentra delicada de salud.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 46-year-old father living with his family in Cayaltí District, a zone with quite a bit of commercial activity located in Lambayeque Province an hour from the city of Chiclayo.  He’s had a home-based grocery store for the last 8 years.  He offers his customers a variety of basic staples there like groceries, vegetables and other perishables.  His customers prefer his store because it always has quality products and good service.  His business allows him to help his wife support the family.  He also works raising barnyard animals and earns daily wages working as a laborer.

Oscar wants to buy more groceries to expand the store and stratify demand so he’s deemed it advisable to request a 3.000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa that will help him reach his goal.  He will also buy medicine for his mother who is in poor health.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Norma Julia

texts.es:
Norma tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia de material noble con su esposo y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío La Pala perteneciente al Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte  rural  del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla Norma es el negocio de crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, producción de leche y posterior venta de leche fresca que son comercializados en la zona.  Norma atiende permanentemente y cuenta con clientela ya establecida. También se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como porcinos, ovinos, y aves de corral. Norma presenta una experiencia de más de 06 años en los negocios de ganadería.  Su esposo se dedica a las labores agrícolas en parcela heredada.  Con los ingresos que perciben ambos, contribuyen a sacar adelante su hogar.

Norma quisiera día con día atender a mucha más clientela en cuanto a la venta de leche, es por ello que quiere comprar mucha más leche para posteriormente venderla.  Por otro lado quisiera sembrar pasto para alimentar a su ganado vacuno y de esta manera incrementar su producción de leche.  Con esto, pretende incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Norma, 45, has a spouse and two children in her care.  She lives in her own house made of substantial materials with her husband and children.  The house is located in Caserío La Pala belonging to Tambogrande District.  She lives in the rural part of the district but does have electricity. 

Norma’s economic activity is raising and selling cattle, producing milk to sell fresh in the zone.  She works permanently and has an established clientele.  She also raises small farm animals like pigs, sheep and barnyard fowl.  Norma has more than 6 years’ experience in animal husbandry businesses.  Her husband works in agriculture on inherited land.  With the income they both earn they contribute towards moving their home forward.

Norma would like day to day to tend to more customers with respect to the milk sales and this is why she wants to buy much more milk to resell later.  On the other hand, she’d like to plant grass to feed her cattle to also increase milk production.  With this, she intends to increase her sales and as a result her income too.  This is why she’s thought it advisable to request a 1,500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell and to plant grass to feed her cattle.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, tiene 58 años de edad, es de estado civil  conviviente, y vive junto a su familia en casa  propia  la cual se ubica en el Caserio Quemazon en el distrito de  Mórrope , ubicada a  una distancia de recorrido en moto de  60  minutos  aproximadamente  desde la ciudad de Lambayeque.  Generalmente el nombre “Carmen” es asignado al género femenino, pero en su caso sus padres decidieron ponerle este nombre.

La actividad que realiza Carmen, es la  crianza  de animales,  actividad que realiza por  más de 10 años, tiempo en el cual, ha adquirido mayor clientela y experiencia en esta actividad.  A los animales los cría, engorda y cuando ya han alcanzado un peso y tamaño adecuado los comercializa en el mercado de la zona y a los comerciantes que visitan su localidad.

Carmen desea invertir en comprar animales y  alimento balanceado para ellos, lo cual le permitirá poder seguir creciendo con su negocio.  Es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Carmen, 58, is in a common-law relationship and lives with his family in his own house. They live in the hamlet of Quemazon in the district of Morrope, which is about 60 minutes by motorcycle from the city of Lambayeque.
Generally the name "Carmen" is given to someone of the female gender, but in his case, his parents decided to give him that name.

Carmen is a livestock farmer, something he's been doing for more than 10 years. In that time, he's acquired many clients and much experience. He breeds animals, fattens them up and when they reach an appropriate weight, he sells them to buyers who come by his place and in the local market.

Carmen wants to invest in buying animals and balanced animal feed, in order to continue growing his business. To accomplish this objective, he's soliciting a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: buy animals to sell and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Camarones Group

texts.es: Mabel tiene 33 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Camarones, es casada y tiene un hijo, su esposo se dedica  a trabajar en las industrias metálicas, ellos residen en la Comunidad de Quebrada de Arena, Tocoa, colon. Mabel comenzó su negocio desde hace tres años y se dedica a la venta de ropa, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 am a 3:00 pm y lo hace de forma ambulante. El préstamo que Mabel solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de ropa con diferentes estilos que llamen la atención de sus clientes. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá tener surtido su negocio. Las dificultades que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos, que cuando es temporada de lluvia sus ventas bajan ya que no puede andar bajo la lluvia y no tiene transporte propio para trasladar su mercadería. Su meta es poder tener su negocio bien establecido, tener su propio local  y tener mucha variedad en sus prendas de vestir. Es el primer financiamiento que Mabel solicita en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Mabel is 33 years old. She is a member of the Camarones Communal Bank. She is married and has one child. Her husband works in the metal industry. They live in the Quebrada de Arena community in Tocoa, Colon. 

Mabel started her business selling clothes three years ago. Her work schedule if from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. and she is a street seller. She needs the loan she is requesting to purchase different styles of clothing that will appeal to her customers so that she will be able to stock her business. The greatest difficulty she faces is related to the weather for when it is raining, her sales drop because she cannot do business on the street when it is raining and she does not own a vehicle to transport her goods.  

Mabel’s goal is to stabilize her business and to own a shop where she has a variety of garments to sell. This is her first loan from FAMA and she expects to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lusmila

texts.es:
Lusmila tiene 54 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y un hermano en Saltur, una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, sus principales clientes son los vecinos de la zona, ella les ofrece diversos artículos de uso diario, por este motivo su negocio cuenta con buena acogida. Tratando siempre de brindar una buena atención, Lusmila trata de proveerse de productos de buena calidad y de atender a sus clientes con un trato amable.

Lusmila desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos, de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Lusmila es conocida en su comunidad por ser una mujer trabajadora y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar cuando se le requiere, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lusmila is 54 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and a brother in Saltur, a community dedicated to trade, agriculture and cattle raising.

She has been selling basic necessities and other groceries in a small store installed in her house for the past 15 years. Her main customers are her neighbors in the area. She offers various products that are used daily, so that her business is well patronized. Always trying to provide good customer service, Luismila tries to stock high quality merchandise and wait on her customers in a friendly manner. 

Lusmila wants to expand her business by buying more products so that she can increase his sales and profits. Consequently she is requesting her first loan for S/. 2,000 from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is well known in her community as a hardworking woman who is always ready to help when asked. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a business woman in order to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries (rice, sugar, noodles, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Leodan

texts.es:
Leodan tiene 34 años de edad, vive con sus padres y no tiene carga familiar.  Su casa está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Leodan es muy conocido en la zona, ya que brinda el servicio de mototaxi, vehículo en el cual transporta pasajeros en distancias cortas  por el Sector La Curva.  Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años, tiempo en el cual ha conseguido mucha más clientela, la cual confía en él.  Leodan tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales.  Su familia es unida, y con los ingresos que percibe apoya con los gastos de su familia.

Leodan desea comprar repuestos para su mototaxi y con ello darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y poder con eso mejorar su servicio.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo en Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles.

Con esta inversión, podrá atender más clientes y obtener ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Leodan, 34, lives with his parents and is without a family of his own. His house is in the Cayaltí district, located one hour away from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the province of Lambayeque. 

Leodan is known in the area because he provides mototaxi service. He takes passengers short distances in the La Curva area. He's been running this business for 3 years and has a clientele that trusts him. Leodan has good personal and work references. His family is united and so he puts his earnings toward the family expenses.

Leodan would like to by spare parts for his mototaxi and provide its maintenance and that way improve his service. To accomplish this objective, he is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

With this investment he'll be able to provide his services to more clients and generate additional income for his family.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his mototaxi and provide its maintenance.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo  es un hombre agricultor de 48  años de edad, el esta casado y vive en Sololá.  El tiene dos hijos varones.  Ellos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad y lo apoyan en el campo en  tiempos libres.
El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cebolla, papa, zanahoria, repollo, rábano y flores  en parcelas que tiene  a pocos metros de su vivienda, esto lo aprendió de su padre cuando el solo estudio en la escuela primaria también apoyaba a su padre en el campo de la agricultura .
El ahora cuenta con quince  años de realizar su propio cultivo viendo que obtiene ganancias buenas cultivando estas verduras,  de este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q 9,000.00 para que el pueda comprar semillas de papa  y su fertilizante para luego cultivarlo y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos y condiciones de vida junto a su familia expandiendo su cultivo.
En un futuro el quiere tener un vivero de arboles y reforestar un área que tiene apoyando al medio ambiente de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 48 year old farmer who is married and lives in Sololá. He has two sons. They study in a school in the community and help out in the field in their free time. 

He makes a living in agriculture, growing onions, potatoes, carrots, cabbage, radish and flowers in plots of land just a few meters from his home. He learned this from his father when he was only in primary school as he also supported his father in the field of agriculture. 

He has now been doing his own cultivation for 15 years making good money watching the vegetables grow. He requests a loan of Q 9,000.00 so that he can buy potato seeds and fertilizer to later grow and harvest, improving their income and living conditions and expanding their farming.

In the future, he wants to have a tree nursery and reforest an area that is supporting the environment of the community.

loans.use: purcharse seeds and fertilizer for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Alex Javier

texts.es:
Alex tiene 21 años de edad,  es de estado civil  conviviente , vive en casa  propia  la cual se ubica en el Caserio Huaca Quemada en el distrito de Mórrope.  Este caserío se  ubica a  una distancia de recorrido en moto de  80  minutos  aproximadamente  desde la ciudad de Lambayeque.

Alex se dedica a la crianza de animales,  actividad que realiza desde que era un niño.  Esta actividad fue enseñada por sus padres, por lo que conoce mucho de este negocio.  Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.

Alex desea comprar animales para su posterior venta y alimento balanceado para ello.  Es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.  Esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Alex is 21 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives in a home of his own located in the Huaca Quemada settlement in the Mórrope district.  This settlement is about 80 minutes from Lambayeque by motorcycle.

Alex raises livestock and has been doing this since he was a child.  His parents taught him this and he knows a lot about this business and he is able to cover his family expenses with this income.

Alex wants to buy animals to resell and also balanced feed for them.  He has requested a loan of 3,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.  This will allow him to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo es un hombre agricultor de   34 años de edad, el esta casado y vive en Sololá.  El tiene siete  hijos tres son varones y cuatro mujeres.  De ellos cuatro estudian en una escuela de la comunidad y lo apoyan en el campo en  tiempos libres.
El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cebolla, papa, zanahoria, ejote y brócoli esto lo cultiva  en parcelas que tiene  a pocos kilómetros  de su vivienda.
 Esta actividad  lo aprendió cuando trabajo con personas ajenas que necesitaban  apoyo en el campo, por que desde pequeño se dedico a trabajar sin que tuviera oportunidad de estudiar en una escuela de su comunidad.
 El ahora cuenta con seis  años de realizar su propio cultivo viendo que obtiene ganancias buenas cultivando estas verduras,  de este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q 4,000.00 para que el pueda comprar semillas de papa  y su fertilizante para luego cultivarlo y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos  junto a su familia.
El quiere expandir su cultivo en mas parcelas  es su mayor sueño y poder darles los estudios académicos a sus hijos para que juntos prosperen.
texts.en:
Mateo is a married, 34-year-old farmer who lives in Sololá.  He has seven children, of which there are three boys and four girls.  Four of them study in a local school and in their free time they help him in the field.  

	He works in agriculture, growing onions, potatoes, carrots, green beans, and broccoli.  He grows these on plots of land which are a few kilometers from his home.

	He learned this trade while working alongside others who needed help in the fields. He has been working since he was a young boy without having the opportunity to study at his local school.  He has been growing his own crops for six years now. Seeing that he is making good profits from growing these vegetables, he is requesting a loan of 4,000 Quetzales so that he will be able to buy fertilizer and potato seeds to later grow and harvest.  This will increase his family's income. He wants to expand his crops onto more plots of land.  

        His biggest dream is to be able to provide his children with an education so that together they can prosper.

loans.use: to buy potato seed and fertilizer for growing crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim used the previous loan to buy maize and beans to sell. He is a 37-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling beans and maize for six years. His hardships are price fluctuation, inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and seasonal weather. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent home, and buying a car. His business goals are buying land to grow crops, expanding his business into new markets, and hiring employees to help expand his business. Ibrahim is requesting a new loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Kanymjan

texts.ru: Канымжан 56 лет, вдова, имеет 4 детей. Канымжан с 1982 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 25,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Канымжан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 дойная  корова, 27 овец и 1 лошадь, ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,Канымжан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы с теленком и 4 молодые лошади. Доходы от кредита Канымжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Kanymjan is 56 years old, a widow, and has 4 children. She has been raising livestock since 1982, having started her business with an initial investment of 25,000 som. Thanks to her hard work, Kanymjan's herd currently includes 1 dairy cow, 27 sheep and 1 horse, while her monthly business profits total roughly 5,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her business, Kanymjan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase 1 cow with a calf and 4 young horses. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase 1 cow with a calf and 4 young horses

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгуль 27 лет, замужем, имеет 1 замечательного сына. Назгуль в качестве основного источника дохода занимается животноводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS) 7 лет назад, благодаря упорному труду Назгуль смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS).На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, 4 лошади и 10 голов овец. Благодаря прибыли от хозяйства, Назгуль оплачивает затраты на основные нужды семьи. Назгуль продает с дома молоко и молочную продукцию.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назгуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки дополнительных голов скота. Что позволит увеличить сбор молока и соответственно доходы семьи.  Доходы от кредита Назгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства и в будущем хочет осуществить свою давлению мечту, приобрести автомобиль.
texts.en:
Nazgul is 27 years old, married, and has a wonderful son. As the main source of income, Nazgul raises livestock. After starting this business with a sum of 20,000 som (KGS), through hard work Nazgul has developed it to the point where it currently earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. Presently, Nazgul's herd includes 4 cows, 4 horses and 10 sheep. She sells their milk and dairy products from her home. Thanks to her business profits, Nazgul can pay for her family's main expenses.

In order to continue developing her business, Nazgul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. This will allow her to increase production of milk and, concomitantly, her family income. Nazgul plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business. In the future, she hopes to realize one of her long-time dreams and buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase cows and sheep

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Bidii Group is located in the Lugari District. It is a group of 12 women and seven men led by Pamela, pictured on the left, sitting with the green purse. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Pamela’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and to grow enough food for the family.

Pamela described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have and even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to buy livestock as an investment for the future. Then she can send her children to school and expand her cash, and horticultural farm.

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Pamela's group will receive 9.5 acres worth of inputs on credit. Irine, a former member of Bidii Group, dropped from the program after the photo was taken.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, commercial maize, and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, commercial maize, and sorghum seed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Lena

texts.ru: Лене 54 года, замужем, имеет двух сыновей. Лена работает фельдшером в местной больнице с окладом в 9221 сом (KGS).Лена в качестве основного источника дохода занимается животноводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) 33 года назад, благодаря упорному труду Лены смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме 6,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 1 корова и 3 бычка.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Лена обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)в первый раз для покупки 4 коров. Что позволит увеличить сбор молока и соответственно доходы семьи. Доходы от кредита Лена планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства и в будущем хочет купить дом для сына.
texts.en:
Lena is a 54-year-old married mother of two sons. She works as a medical assistant in the local hospital. Her salary is 9,221 som. However, as Lena is the main income provider for her family, she also works in animal husbandry. She started her business with 5,000 som 33 years ago. Thanks to persistent work, she has been able to develop her farm so that milk sales provide her with a monthly profit of 6,000 som. Today she has one cow and three steer on her farm. 

With long term development of her farm in mind, Lena turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 120,000 som to purchase four cows, which would allow her to increase her milk production and as a result her family's income. Lena plans to invest this new income to develop her farm and eventually to buy a home for her son.

loans.use: to help Lena buy 4 cows

loans.name: Naarkul

texts.ru: Нааркул 58 лет, замужем.Нааркул имеет незаконченное  высшее образование, с ранних лет она занимается сельским хозяйством и имеет огромный опыт. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 7,500 сом (KGS)в 1992 году , благодаря упорному труду, Нааркул смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). В ведении бизнеса ей активно помогают муж и дочка, они занимаются сбытом молока. Сейчас в хозяйстве Нааркул имеется 2 коровы, 1 бычок и 5 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нааркул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) для покупки 1 коровы. С приобретением коровы она сможет увеличить сбор молока, тем самым удовлетворив весь спрос на её молоко. Доходы от кредита Нааркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства и обновить мебель.
texts.en:
Naarkul is a 58-year-old married woman. She did not complete her college education, but she has worked in farming for many years and has a wealth of experience. She started her business with 7,500 som in 1992. Thanks to persistent work, Naarkul was able to develop her farm and it now brings her a monthly profit of 5,000 som. Naarkul's husband and daughter actively help her run the business. They organize milk sales. Today she has two cows, one steer, and five sheep on her farm. 

With long term development of her farm in mind, Naarkul turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 som to purchase a cow. A new cow will allow her to increase milk production to meet demand. She plans to invest the extra income in future development of her farm and to renovate her furniture.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a forty-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for fifteen years. With the proceeds she has been able to build rentals and farm for additional income. Her business is usually at peak during festive seasons and when students are on holiday. She hopes to have a bigger business despite high taxes and clients who do not pay on time. Margret is requesting for a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fotimakhon

texts.ru: Фотимахону 28 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Детям 9, 7 и 4 года. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и его доход не позволяет ему обеспечить семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Фотимахон должна сама справляться с ежедневными расходами. Ей очень тяжело обеспечить 3 детей, и она решила организовать свой бизнес и таким образом получить доход, так как ее муж очень редко посылает им деньги.  С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет открыть свадебный салон в своем доме.  От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 800 сомони для покупки некоторых техник, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Fotimakhon is a 28-year-old married mother of three. Her children are nine, seven, and four years old. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation, but his income is not enough to support all the family's needs. Hence, Fotimakhon has to deal with the family's family's daily expenses on her own. It is very difficult for Fotimakhon to support three children. She decided to start her own business in order to create an income for herself since her husband rarely sends them money. 

With this goal in mind, she took the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women. She received a certificate from the program. Now that she is fully capable of successfully starting her own business, she wants to open a wedding salon in her home. She plans to use the extra income to make sure her children have a good education and healthy diet. She is requesting a loan of 800 som to purchase some technological devices needed to start her business. She is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To buy some technological devices for her wedding salon

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay workers

loans.name: Twitekumurimo Gtmb Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Patrick est membre du groupe solidaire TWITEKUMURIMO GTMB. Il fait l’agriculture du riz. Il est marié et a 45 ans. Il n’a pas d’enfant et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge. Il est né au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de l’école primaire. 
Il a adhéré à ACB Ltd en 2012. Il est au premier cycle de crédit.
Avec ce crédit, il va acheter 100 kilos d’engrais chimiques et paiera la main d’œuvre.
Il n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
La demande d’autres prêts dans le futur constitue sa stratégie qui va lui permettre d’accroitre son activité agricole.
Pour son activité financée, il a l’ambition d’être le meilleur cultivateur du riz dans le pays.
Pour sa famille, il va construire une maison en briques.
texts.en:
Patrick is a member of the TWITEKUMURIMO GTMB solidarity group.  He is a rice farmer.  He is 45 years old, married, and doesn't have any children.  He does not have any further dependents.  He was born in Rwanda and completed 6 years of elementary school.

Patrick joined ACB Ltd in 2012.  This is his first loan cycle.

Patrick will use this loan to buy 100 kilos of chemical fertilizers and to pay workers.  He does not foresee any difficulties in repaying his loan.  He plans to  request further loans in the future in order to grow his farming business.  His business goal is to become the best rice grower in the country and his personal goal is to build a brick house.

loans.use: to buy 100kg of chemical fertilizers and to pay workers

loans.name: Takku Ligguey Jeumbeut Garab Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit Takku Liggey Jeubeut Garab regroupe 1 femme et 4 hommes qui logent dans le même village. Il est dirigé par madame Oulèye qui s’active dans l’agriculture, plus précisément le maraichage depuis plus de 15 ans maintenant. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle sollicite un crédit de 800000F CFA pour l’achat de semences de pomme de terre, oignons et l’achat d’engrais et de fumier pour son exploitation culturale. Oulèye participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Avec le crédit reçu, elle pourra désormais épargner afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Elle souhaite avec une augmentation de capital, exploiter d’autres périmètres.
texts.en: The 'Takku Liggey Jeubeut Garab' loan group consists of one woman and four men who all live in the same village.  The group is led by Oulèye who works in agriculture.  More exactly, she is a market gardener.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  Oulèye is married and a mother.  She is requesting a loan for 800,000 CFA to buy potato seeds, onion seeds, fertilizers and manure for her agricultural business.  Oulèye helps cover her family's daily expenses.  With this loan, she will be able to start saving so that she can better meet her children's needs.  She hopes, with an increase in capital, to be able to start working in other areas.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, onion seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Serigne Abdou Khadre

texts.fr: Monsieur Serigne Abdou Khadre vit au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le secteur du commerce. Il gère une alimentation dans la localité ou il habite. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de prendre en charges ses besoins personnels, d’assurer  les dépenses de location de la chambre qu’il occupe et du magasin ou il exerce son activité. Il est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC de la localité ou il vit. Il sollicite un prêt de 500 000 frs. Une partie du financement sera utilisé pour l’achat de denrées alimentaires qu’il avait l’habitude de commercialiser. L’autre partie servira pour l’achat de céréales  dans le but de diversifier les produits qu’il vend. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices pour mieux développer son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Serigne Abdou Khadre lives in Senegal.  He is single and has been working in commerce for more than 10 years.  He runs a grocery store in his town.  The income he makes from his business allows him to cover his personal needs and to pay the rent on both the room that he lives in and the store where he runs his business.  He is a member of the UIMCEC office in his town.  He is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs.  Part of the loan will be used to buy more of the foodstuffs he currently sells.  The rest will be used to buy cereals so that he can diversify his product offerings.  His goal is to increase his profits so that he can better develop his business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and cereals to re-sell

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор жительница Гиссарского района. Ей 53 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Гулбахор занимается купле – продажей фисташек. Этим видом бизнеса она занимается 7 лет. Гулбахор берет кредит для покупки фисташек и грецких орехов.
texts.en: Gulbahor is a resident of the Gissar region. She is a 53-year-old married mother of six. She has been selling pistachios for seven years now. She would like this loan to purchase pistachios and walnuts.

loans.use: to purchase pistachios and walnuts

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо 39 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Детям 20, 17, 15 и 10 лет. Условия их жизни очень тяжелые. Ее муж простой рабочий и не в состоянии обеспечить семью. Дети выросли и требуют все больше благ. Мархабо срочно надо найти источника дохода. Она решила организовать свой бизнес скотоводством.  С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Marhabo is a 39-year-old married mother of four. Her children are 20, 17, 15, and 10 years old. Their living conditions are very difficult. Her husband is a simple worker and is not in a position to support the family. The children are grown and demand more and more economic resources. Marhabo urgently needs to find a source of income. So, she decided to start her own cattle breeding business. 

With that goal in mind, she took the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women. She received a certificate for this course. She is now fully capable of successfully starting her own business. She plans to use the extra income to provide her children with a good education and healthy diet. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 som to purchase cattle to start her new business. She is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Cheikh est cultivateur depuis plus de 20 ans. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 17h du soir. Il est marié et père de famille. Il a tout juste besoin de cent mille francs pour acheter des oignons, du poivron, et des intrants agricoles. Cheikh est un père de famille qui s’occupe seul de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. Le crédit a impacter sur sa vie, puisque sa lui a permis d’épargner  mais aussi d’améliorer l’alimentation de ses enfants. Comme projet futur : il désire clôturer un de ses champs qui est proche du village.
texts.en: Cheikh has been farming for more than 20 years.  He starts his workday at 8.00am and finishes at 5.00pm.  He is married and a father.  He needs 100,000 francs to buy onions, bell peppers and farming supplies.  Cheikh is a father who is solely responsible for covering his household's daily expenses.  The loan has impacted his life as as it has allowed him to save and also to improve the food he feeds his children.  In the future, he would like to fence off one of his fields which is near the village.

loans.use: to buy onions, bell peppers and farming supplies

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a forty year old married man with three children living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been a operating a craft shop for four years and also has a transport business as additional income. David was inspired into art by his love for nature and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children and build a house. He desires to educate his children up to the University level while his business plan for himself  is an art gallery in the city. David intends to use the money from the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en: Moureen is a forty two year old single mother with two children living in Kasese,Uganda. She sells clothes and fish. With the proceeds she has been able to meet the basic needs of her family. Price fluctuation and the seasonal nature of her business are her major challenges. Her dreams are to educate her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and also to own a boutique. Moureen intends to use the loan to buy clothes ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a fifty two year old married man with eight children living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been running a pharmacy business for twelve years and also earns a salary as a health worker in a government hospital. His dream is to educate his children up to the University level while his business plan is to own his own pharmacy despite challenges of inadequate capital. Josephat is requesting a loan to buy medicine to sell.

loans.use: to buy medicine to sell.

loans.name: Kibaya

texts.en: Kibaya used his previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. He is a 37-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for five years. He acquired capital by selling coffee worth 700,000 shillings and now has 4,000,000 shillings as working capital. His hardships are customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to purchase stock and high taxes. His business goals are to expand his business into new markets and move the business to a more permanent location.  His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house. Kibaya intends to use the money to buy clothes, sugar  and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sugar  and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a fifty-eight-year-old married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He sells timber in an urban area and rents our property; he does farming for additional income. His major customers are builders, carpenters and schools. 

His dreams are to educate his children, build a permanent house to live in, and own a furniture workshop, despite the challenges of poor roads. Paul is requesting a loan to buy timber to sell.

loans.use: to buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou évolue dans le secteur de la couture. Il habite au Sénégal. Il a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans son activité. Il est veuf et n’a que sa propre personne en charge. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’une chambre a coucher. Son intention est de s’équiper  pour améliorer son cadre de vie social. Son vœu est de disposer d’une grande entreprise de confection de boubous sportifs.
texts.en: Mamadou lives in Senegal and works as a tailor.  He has more than 5 years experience in his business.  He is a widower and doesn't have any dependents.  He is a member of one of UIMCEC's offices and is requesting a loan for 200,000 francs to buy a bedroom set.  His aim is to equip himself so that he can improve his social life.  His wish is to own a large business which produces sports clothing.

loans.use: to buy a bedroom set

loans.name: Nason

texts.en: Nason is a thirty-four-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a renowned farmer who grows bananas and coffee. With the proceeds from this work, he has been able to build rental houses and buy land. Unpredictable seasonal weather changes affect his profit predictions. His dream is to buy more land and expand his farming activities. Nason intends to use the money to buy land to farm.

loans.use: to buy land to farm.

loans.name: Rosset

texts.en: Rosset is a forty-year-old single mother of three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a restaurant, a business she has been running for eight years. She says she started it through the savings obtained from selling secondhand clothes. Though the capital amount that started the restaurant was small, she says it has grown, and she feels happy about it. Her hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house for her family. She dreams of expanding into new markets so as to have increased sources of income. Rosset used her previous loan to buy customer chairs for her restaurant, and she intends to use this new loan to buy food to sell,

loans.use: to buy food to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Rozet

texts.en: Rozet is a twenty-six-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She works with the town council and has been in service for three years. She has dreams of educating her children up to university and upgrading her own studies. She says that her salary alone does not allow her to meet the basics of her family. Her desire is to venture into agriculture. Rozet intends to use this loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Ezinabala Group

texts.en:
Eva is a 55-year-old woman who operates a cosmetic shop in Jjandira village; she began this business because she wanted to raise money to pay school fees for her children. She has seven children, and two of them are in school. 

Her main challenges include bad debtors, price fluctuations, high rent, and competition in her village. She would like to expand her business to get more income to support her grandchildren, and meet their school fees requirements.

The loan will help her buy body jelly, hair oil and other products to sell. These products will be on high demand now, since it's near the festive season and people want to look good during Christmas. She is sure she will have big sales!

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en: Mjeni is a devoted woman who has the urge to move forward. She has been selling firewood for several years with good results. Mjeni says that she was able to start a charcoal selling business alongside her firewood business. She narrates that the previous loan she had taken was of great help to her. This current loan will enable her to buy sacks of charcoal to increase the stock she has in her store. This way she is sure to increase sales and profits. Her goal is to see her businesses flourish.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is an active and enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work. She is a fighter with many goals that she wants to achieve. She is working hard to reach a more prosperous future and is very happy with her business. She has been engaged in food vending for some time. She has been able to save money to expand her line of operation. She currently operates a kiosk, which is still in its initial stages of growth. However, she is optimistic that it will grow to a bigger retail shop.

Selina wants to stock her kiosk with basic grains, foodstuffs, cleaning products, etc. She is asking for a new loan to invest in the purchase of this merchandise. She has good pay references and is responsible. She promises to settle the debt and at the same time has hope that she will bring home financial security and a better quality of life for everyone.

loans.use: to stock her kiosk with basic grains, foodstuffs, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Mathumuni Group

texts.en:
Eunice's group has 20 farmers and is located in Lugari District. Eunice is pictured on the right of the Mathumuni Group with her hand raised. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Eunice’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer that will allow her to grow enough food for her family.

Eunice described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She plans to spend the money that she earns from her next harvest on sending her children to school, saving for the future and perhaps investing in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Eunice’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 10 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, commercial maize, and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Maculada

texts.en:
Maculada is 39 years old and married. She has seven children; six of them are in school. 

She is now applying for a loan from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin).  She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies/stock to keep in her kiosk and resell.

Maculada is living in a town which is about 1 Km from the city. Beside running a kiosk, she also buys firewood from a place where people sell firewood at a very low price. 

In the future, she wants to make her business bigger.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, sugar, coffee and firewood to resell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.  For the past 15 years, Joan has been working hard to manage her poultry business, selling eggs and chicken. 

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy poultry feed for the chicks, to get better eggs.  This will help Joan generate greater profits, increase the stock, and grow the business.  

Joan hopes that in the future she will be able to have a big business . 

Joan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Joan, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed for the chicks, to increase egg production.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married  and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, George has been working hard to manage his spare parts store where he sells motor spare parts. 

To help expand his business, George has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts to sell and will help George to generate greater profits and buy more spare parts. George hopes that in the future he will be able to supply a greater variety of spare parts to his customers. 

George is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like George who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima lives in the town of Samburu in the province of Coast. She is 24 years old and a married mother of two children who are currently in school. 

Mwanalima decided to start a meat goat business three years ago. She says that it has been a profitable project. She is requesting this loan in the amount of KES 30,000 to buy more goats for sale. Mwanalima says that it is a job that needs a lot of dedication since it has many challenges.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married  and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, Richard  has been working hard to manage his health clinic. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine and machines that are used for examining patients. The loan will help Richard to generate greater profits. Richard hopes that in the future he will be able to produce more quality products. 

Richard  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Richard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine and machines that are used for examining patients.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is taking out another loan to expand his existing business. He wants to buy some pigs. With the previous loan, he was able to earn more  sales revenue, which improved his family's living standards. He is very sure that this loan will also have a positive impact on his business. Emmanuel would like to thank Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy some pigs.

loans.name: Nasif

texts.en:
Nasif is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has three children. Nasif is the only provider in his family.

Nasif is a barber who owns barber shop. He established his business in 2003 and now he has one employee. He has earned good experience in this field, and he has an excellent reputation in the surrounding area.

He is requesting a sum of $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent on his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his barber shop.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, soap and salt. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, soap, salt and other commodities to resell. This inventory boost will help Godfrey generate greater profits and produce quality products. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to produce more quality products. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, salt and other commodities to resell.

loans.name: Semu

texts.en:
Semu is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. 

For the past three years, Semu has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells flour, sugar, rice, etc. 

To help expand his business, Semu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more products such as flour, sugar and rice for resale and will help Semu to generate greater profits and buy more goods. Semu hopes that in the future he will be able to produce more quality products. 

Semu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Semu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more products such as flour, sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is 25 years old and is a very hardworking man. He is a native of Samburu and lives with his wife and their two children. 

Hamza has a grocery store in his home. He started with a few items and began to increase with the help of his own savings and the loans he got through Yehu. He says that his work requires a lot of sacrifice because only he and his wife work out of the whole family. His dream is to set up a supermarket in his neighborhood.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy flour, noodles, breads, rice, cooking fat and other supplies that make up his greatest sales.

loans.use: to buy flour, noodles, breads, rice, cooking fat and other supplies that make up his greatest sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, commercial maize, and sorghum seed.

loans.name: David L.

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old David L. He is single and has one child, age 1 year 4 months. 

In 2005, David L. established his clothing business. He began his business because after he graduated from college, he was not fortunate to have a job and was advised by a friend who was a trader to join his business. 

Instead of sitting idling at home, he started with a small amount from his savings. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 506,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. David L. requires a loan in order to purchase men's sport shorts - 1 bale @ SLL 2,000,000; children's wear - 1 bale @ SLL 1,000,000, and men's shirts - 1 bale @ SLL 1,000,000. 

Competition in his line of business is high and he requires enough capital to buy goods that are in great demand.

In the future, David L. plans to expand his business and open a store befitting his large stock. He is a hardworking business man. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: to purchase men's sport shorts, children's wear and men's shirts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pans, hot pots, rubber buckets, enamel cups and fruit plates.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Qudratullo

texts.ru: Кудратулло проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 30 лет. У него двое детей. Его дети маленькие. Жена Кудратулло занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам он по профессии экономист, но он не работает в этой области. Кудратулло вот уже 7 лет занимается животноводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кудратулло берет кредит для закупа двух коров.
texts.en: Qudratullo lives in the Rudaki region of Tajikistan. He is 30 years old and has two small children. His wife takes care of the household. Qudratullo is an economist by profession, but does not work in this specialty. Instead, for the past 7 years he has been engaged in animal husbandry. He earns his living by raising cattle. Qudratullo is taking this loan to purchase two cows.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Zumratbi

texts.ru: Зумратби проживает в городе Душанбе. Она 54 – летняя женщина. Она замужем. Зумратби является матерью четверых детей. Она вместе с сыновьями занимается торговлей на рынке. Торговлей Зумратби занимается пять лет. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает женскую обувь. Зумратби берет кредит для завоза нового товара.
texts.en: Zumratbi lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 54 years old, married, and a mother of four children. Together with her sons, Zumratbi has been engaged in retail at a market for the past five years. She rents a stall where she sells women's footwear. Zumratbi is taking this loan to stock up on new merchandise.

loans.use: to buy women's winter footwear

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 28, lives with her husband and their four children.

She runs a store where she sells essential items such as basic grains, beverages, oils and other products. The store is located in her home and is very well known because she is a good salesperson and sells quality products at low prices. 

Margaret is very dedicated to her work and is always looking for ways to prosper. She wants to stay ahead of the competition and invest in her business, but she is in need of capital. Therefore she has requested a loan from Yehu to buy basic grains, instant products, sweets, bread, beverages, flour, etc.

Margaret is able to make payments on her loan and has a good credit record. She is happy to receive the support and is confident she can pay back the loan on time, while giving her family the more fulfilling life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant products, sweets, bread, beverages, flour, etc.

loans.name: Housein

texts.en:
Housein is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 23 years old and married, who lives with five family members, of whom two are employed.

Housein owns an aluminum workshop. He specializes in making doors and windows. He established his business in 2010, and now he has an employee. He has good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 to purchase equipment to work with construction grade PVC plastic and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to work with PVC and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Aminata M.

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Aminata. She is widowed and has one child, age 6 years, who goes to school. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because she got him during the civil war.  

In 1997, Aminata established her business selling shoes, traveling bags, pan sets, flasks, women's dresses, etc. She began her business because she stopped school in class four. Her aunt did not allow her to further her schooling and she was attached to her aunt's shop.  When she fully matured, her elder sister sent money from abroad to start her business. 

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase plastic shoes - 20 bundles @ SLL 144,000, and pan sets - 1 set @ SLL 70,000. The balance of SLLL 50,000 will be used for transport. 

In the future, Aminata plans to complete her house, acquire a shop and educate her child and dependent. The loan will help to increase stock and generate more income.  

Inadequate capital is her major challenge. She is hardworking and committed to her business  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase plastic shoes, pan sets and transport.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Mariama.  She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 11. 

In 2002, Mariama established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to be of great help to her husband, and to adequately care for their children. 

Her business is located in  the city center, and her main customers are business people in food and catering, and households using charcoal.  Her business is open 7 days a week and 12 hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5000000. Mariama would use the loan to buy large quantities of charcoal, and to do little repairs in her store. 

In the future, Mariama plans to buy a big truck to transport the charcoal and do little repairs in her store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en:
Enkhbaatar, 29, lives with his wife and two children in a rented house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital. Since 2010 Enkhbaatar has been managing a PC game center by renting a 40-square-meter house. His wife has worked as a packer in a private pharmaceutical company for 4 years. His boys go to kindergarten. His business is going well. 

Initially Enkhbaatar started the business with 6 PCs and now he has 20 PCs. Throughout the day Enkhbaatar stays on his business and night times he runs a taxi to gain extra income for his family. In 2006 his family bought a plot of land in an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. In the meantime, they have been building a house and it’s 80% complete. 

Enkhbaatar spent all the money he saved since he began his business to build a house. Now he is short on money and due to that, his building has to stop. Therefore, Enkhbaatar is a requesting a loan to complete his house. Using the loan, he will do interior decoration and install a low-pressure furnace, which emits less carbon dioxide into the atmosphere, and build a barn where the house door meets with outside.

loans.use: to do interior decoration, install a low-pressure furnace, and to build a barn where the house door meets with outside.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 42 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is single and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past 18 years, Rose  has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Rose  has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase the size of the business and have more space for her customers to sit, and will help Rose  to generate greater profits and purchase foods at a lower price and in higher quantity. Rose  hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Rose  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase the size of the business and have more space for her customers to sit

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 30 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi  in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Dennis  has been working hard to manage his electronics store, which sells televisions and mobile phones. 

To help expand his business, Dennis  has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to procure more televisions and mobile phones for resale, and will help Dennis  to generate greater profits and improve his stock, hence more income and a higher standard of living. Dennis  hopes that in the future he will be able to make the business grow. 

Dennis  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dennis  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to procure more televisions and mobile phones for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Having been a mere housewife who took care of the house for about five years, Josephine was introduced to selling beauty products out of her home by a friend and saw it as a way to supplement her income. Since beginning one year ago, she has greatly expanded not only her area of business, but has also taken on a managerial role with several other product sellers working under her. Josephine enjoys being her own boss and having the ability to work with different clients and other product sellers.

Due to lack of credit, she approached Yehu in order to find financing for her business and help provide financial support for her family.

This is Josephine’s first loan with Yehu. She wants to use it to buy more products in bulk in order to sell them at a better price and expand her business. She also wants to be able to continue growing her clients' confidence in her product. This loan will increase her abilities as a businesswoman and help her continue to enhance her position within the beauty product market.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Lameka

texts.en:
Lameka is 49 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi  in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married  and has seven children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Lameka has been working hard to manage his poultry farm, which sells chickens. 

To help expand his business, Lameka has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to develop the business and build more space for the chicks to grow, and will help Lameka to generate greater profits to improve his standard of living and pay school fees for his children. Lameka hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the poultry farm. 

Lameka is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lameka who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to build more space for the chicks to grow in.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
